There are no scenarios, just army lists with unit costs. Players choose armies of equal value, line them up on opposite sides of the table and have at it. Terrain and weather can be added.

114116.name: Fluke
114116.description:
Fluke - The Wealth Building Game of Accidental Inventions

Fluke simulates Corporate America - the wild, wild world of intellectual property that is grounded in inventions and entrepreneurship. Players will experience thrilling scientific research, wacky inventions, stock explosions, gigantic wealth and legal duels. Many world changing, highly profitable inventions were created by accident while in the midst of scientific research to discover something else. These inventions would have never been created if someone was not creatively seeking to solve a problem.

Everyone is memorializing Steve Jobs as he dominated Corporate America setting an even faster pace for the wild, wild world of Intellectual Property. Here’s your chance to see if you can dominate Corporate America like he did. Show your corporate executive skills by building the largest portfolio of cash, patents and research corporations.

Players will maneuver through the Risk and Rewards of the wild, wild world of intellectual property acquiring patents, research corporations and of course, cash. The game ends when the first person loses all of their cash. Each game participant will tally their portfolio. The game participant with the largest portfolio wins.

GAME PLAY

At the beginning of the Fluke game, a player is selected to be the manager of the Venture Fund. The Venture Fund holds 2.4 billion dollars, the patents, and research corporations. Each player receives 200 million dollars from the Venture Fund. They will roll the die and land on a game space. They have the option of:

1. Paying a licensing fee to the owner of the patent / research corporation

2. Purchasing the patent/ research corporation indicated on the game space from the Venture Fund if no player owns it.

3. “Wheel and deal” with another player for purchase of their patent/ research corporation. Resale prices are indicated on the back of cards. If it reads “negotiable”, Name your best price and wait to see if another player accepts your price.

If a player lands on the stock explosion space, they can explode any patent or research corporation they own. They will receive the stock explosion marker and the cash from the Venture Fund.

GAME ENDS

First person to run out of cash the game ends. Each player will count their cash, tally up the resale prices of their patents and research corporations. The person with the largest portfolio values win. Players can continue to play after portfolio tally is complete.

114117.name: The Lichten Spell
114117.description:
A dark and mysterious blight has come to the Great Kingdom of the Mystic World. There has been no hint of sun for 500 days. With the people starving, the king turns to his four court magicians to cast an ancient spell known as the “Lichten Spell” which will again turn their kingdom to light. The first magician to cast the spell correctly will become the Great Court Magician and a hero of the Kingdom.

In order to cast the spell a magician must follow the recipe. The balance of Elements needed to cast the spell changes with the wind and from moment to moment. The four magicians now race to determine the precise mixture of elements and be the first to cast the spell correctly.

The game begins with an auction for each of the Elements. As play begins, each player makes three moves per turn, spending their Elements to both learn and change the requirements for victory.

The Lichten Spell requires many skills to win. It is one part bidding game to obtain precious Elements. It is one part mystery as players race to identify face-down cards. It is one part strategic thinking as players try to figure out three moves which will leave them with the proper amounts of Elements to win the game. Most of all, The Lichten Spell is a thought-provoking battle where no two games are the same!

114118.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 1 - Sep 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Ganymede - Imperial Victorian Forces of War
Tactical Manual - Crystal Lotus Elves in Chronopia
The Slave Pit - Creating Battle Standards
114118.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114119.name: Stop and Go
114119.description:
Promotional game published by Shell, the petrol and oil supplier.

Essentially, this is a roll and move game but the winner is not the first player to reach home. In fact, the game does not end until all players have reached home. Then the winner is the player with the most petrol (gas) still in their car.

Cards are drawn when you arrive on certain squares and these often give you more petrol ar make you use up petrol.

114120.name: Wege nach Myranor
114120.description:
user summary

This is the base rules on character generation for playing in Myranor.
It features several races, cultures and professions, advantages and disadvantages.

Both a normal and a limited (to 250) version are available, only the covers look different.

114121.name: Superman Flying Bingo
114121.description:
This has nothing to do with the traditional game of Bingo.

Each player is given a supply of Superman discs. There are four colours so four can play. Each player flicks their discs on to the board which is a grid of 5 x 5 pockets. If a disc settles within a pocket, it stays there. The objective of each player is to form a row of five of his colour discs, to win the game. Getting five in a row is the only link to a Bingo game.

114122.name: Mickey Mouse's Tree House Game
114122.description:
Each player is given ten pieces in their chosen colour. In a turn, the player spins the spinner. If he spins a ladder then he can place one of his pieces on the next rung of the ladder. If he spins a number, he can move his character piece up the completed rungs. If he spins a broken ladder, then he must take away a ladder piece.
The first player to complete his ladder with his ten playing pieces and move up to the tree house, wins.

rpgseries: TYMA - Living Forgotten Realms Tymanther Regional Adventures
114123.name: Tying Up Loose Ends
114123.description:
From the first page of the adventure:

Evil cults have menaced the residents of Tymanther on several past occasions, with threats ranging from Ruinspoke to Djerad Thymar to the Black Ash Plains. New information suggests that now is the time to strike at one particular cult’s leadership and put an end to its activities in the region once and for all. But those who supply such valuable secrets often have their own agendas. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Tymanther for characters levels 14- 17 (the P2 level band, using the Year 1 / Year 2 mustering rules; see the LFR Campaign Guide for details). Characters not within the listed level range may not play this adventure. Damage expressions in this adventure have been updated to Monster Manual 3 standards.
This adventure is a loose sequel to TYMA1-3 Tools of the Trade and a direct sequel to TYMA1-6 Troubled Roads, and wraps up storylines from both those adventures. It is therefore of interest to characters who participated in TYMA1-3 and/or TYMA1-6. Play of either or both of the previous adventures is neither required nor assumed, however.

114124.name: Midgard: Schlüssel zum Abenteuer
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114124.description:
User Summary:

Midgard: Schlüssel zum Abenteuer (Midgard: The Key to Adventures) contained advanced rules for combat and wielding magic.
It brought 70 new spells of spell levels 4 to 6, 120 new creatures and 80 magical artifacts. It also contained chapters about creating NPCs, overland journeys and writing your own adventures.

114125.name: Hidden and Dangerous 2: Sabre Squadron
114125.description:
The expansion pack titled Sabre Squadron was released during October 19, 2004, in the US, introduced nine new single player missions, seven new multiplayer maps, and a now finished, deathmatch map called "Poland", which had been featured in the game's intro and was titled "London" and available for play in its unfinished state before this release, new weapons: the RPzB 54, the MAS-36, the G43, a suppressed P08 and a Harrington & Richardson Mk VI flare pistol; a co-operative multiplayer mode is also added. Other enhancements such has emptying the lungs while sniping were included along with the access to original Hidden and Dangerous 2 missions through Sabre Squadron's interface.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hidden and Dangerous 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114126.name: Riket
114126.description:
Back of the book (in Swedish)

Riket
Konungariket Bayern

I konungariket Bayern härskar den galne Sebastian Müller med järnhand. Men järnhanden har börjat rosta.

Gammal och paranoid, börjar nu Sebastian förlora greppet om Riket. Missnöjda officerare i Sebastians privata livgarde, die Schwartze Grenadiere, börjar se sig om efter högre positioner.

I ruinstaden Stuttgart utspelas konflikter mellan de lokala gängen om makten i staden. I ruinstaden finns möjligheter att sälja och köpa utrustning, skaffa sig nya kontakter och ovänner, och naturligtvis, deltaga i sportevenemang med livet som insats...

Modulen innehåller: information om Riket, organisationen Kreuzbund, gängen i Stuttgart och naturligtvis, flera mindre äventyr.

User translation

The Realm
The Kingdom of Bavaria

The Kingdom of Bavaria is ruled with an iron fist by the crazy Sebastian Müller. But the iron fist has begun to rust.

Old and paranoid, Sebastian is now losing his grip on The Realm. Disgruntled officers in Sebastian's private royal guard, die Schwartze Grenadiere, has begun to look for higher positions.

In the ruin city of Stuttgart a conflict for control of the city between local gangs is unfolding. In the ruin city it is possible to sell and buy equipment, make new contacts and enemies, and of course, participate in sporting events with your life on stake...

This module contains: information about The Realm, the organization Kreuzbund, the gangs in Stuttgart and, of course, several smaller adventures.

114127.name: Bürger, Bettler, Beutelschneider
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114127.description:
User Summary:

Bürger, Bettler, Beutelschneider (Citizen, Beggar, Cutpurse) is a boxed set for city adventures on Magira. It contained two books:

Tidford: Stadt am Tuarisc, a description of the city Tidford. It is a translated and adapted version of Tulan of the Isles (Third Edition).
Regeln für Stadtabenteuer, a rulebook about city adventures. It is a translated and adapted version of Cities (Second Edition).




It also contained a map of Tidford and a map of the world Magira.

114128.name: Jenseits der Hügel
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114128.description:
User Summary:

Jenseits der Hügel is a partially translated and adapted version of Towns of the Outlands. It contains the description of five small towns or villages:


Qum-Al-Nashir - a desert oasis designed by Wesley M. Divin
Cuisgillin (Winter Creek) - a smugglers cove designed by Russell Young
Birka - a northern trading center designed by Richard A. Edwards
MacArans Rasthaus (Morrison's Roadhouse) - a woodland crossing designed by Wesley M. Divin
Chrysoron(Goldcrest) - a mining camp designed by Russell Young

114129.name: Unter den Nebelbergen
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114129.description:
From the back of the book:

Vor einigen Jahrhunderten gewannen die dunklen Mächte im Ewigen Kampf zwischen Licht und Finsternis, der das beherrschende Thema magiranischer Mythen ist, urplötzlich die Oberhand. Aus dieser Zeit stammt ein ausgedehntes Höhlensystem unter den Nebelbergen, das einem der Fürsten der Finsternis als Hauptquartier diente. Noch heute stößt man auf Fallen und Rätsel, die genauso wie die natürlichen Gefahren des unterirdischen Labyrinths dem wagemutigen Abenteurer zum Verhängnis werden können. Lange Zeit war die Anlage verlassen, doch vor hundert Jahren suchten hier von ihren Feinden bedrängte Orcs Zuflucht. Ihre Zahl nahm ständig zu, und jetzt bilden sie eine ernste Gefahr für alle Reisenden, die sich in die menschenleere Wildnis der Nebelberge verirren.

Bei einem ihrer Überfälle fiel der Zauberring des Weisen Thalion in die Hände der Orcs. Thalion ist nun auf der Suche nach tapferen Abenteurern, die ihn in das Labyrinth unter den Nebelbergen begleiten, um den Ring zurückzugewinnen. Laßt ihr Euch von der großzügigen Belohnung und der Aussicht auf ein aufregendes Abenteuer verlocken, Thalion in die Orchöhlen zu begleiten? Gelingt es Euch, den Ring zu finden? Oder entmutigen Euch die Geschichten von feuerspeienden Drachen, riesigen Spinnen, Bergtrollen und ganzen Heerscharen grausamer Orcs, die man sich von den Nebelbergen erzählt?

Unter den Nebelbergen ist ein spielbereites, illustriertes Abenteuer für Midgard und andere Fantasy-Rollenspiele mit Karten und ausführlichen Erläuterungen für den Spielleiter.


Translation:

A few centuries ago the dark forces all of a sudden won the upper hand in the eternal struggle between light and darkness, which is the dominant theme of magiran myths. From this period an extensive cave system exists under the Misty Mountains, which served as headquarters for one of the Princes of Darkness. Even today we come to traps and puzzles that can be just like the natural dangers of the underground labyrinth of the daring adventurer's undoing. For a long time facility was deserted, but a hundred years orc, oppressed by their enemies, found refuge here. Their numbers grew steadily, and now they are a serious threat to all travelers who stray into the empty wilderness of the Misty Mountains.

On one of their latest raids the magic circle of the wise Thalion fell into the hands of the orcs. Thalion is now looking for brave adventurers to accompany him into the labyrinth beneath the Misty Mountains to reclaim the ring. Do you let entice you by the generous reward and the promise of an exciting adventure to accompany Thalion into the Orc caves? Will you succeed to find the ring? Or discourage you the stories of fire-breathing dragons, giant spiders, mountain trolls and whole hosts of cruel orcs, which are told about the Misty Mountains?

Under the Misty Mountains is a ready to play, illustrated adventure for Midgard, and other fantasy role-playing games with maps and detailed explanations for the game master.

114130.name: Dynasty
114130.description:
Back of book:

A complete guide on founding, growing and running your own world in Traveller, this book enables the creation of sociologically diverse solar systems or even empires. Covering a wide range of aspects involving governments, infrastructure, trade, military defences and even religion, it also allows the development of these unique polities over time; investments, conflicts and random events during their growth - or indeed, possible collapse!

Whether you are a band of adventurers colonising or conquering their own planet, or seeking to play out a generational game of developing sector-wide dominions, Dynasty will add depth and colour to any Traveller campaign.

114131.name: Swords and Glory Volume 2: Tékumel Player's Handbook
114131.description:
Excerpt from the introduction:

The fantasy role-playing game presented in the following pages is based upon the fictional world of Tékumel. An introduction to this mythos will be found in the Sourcebook: i.e. Volume 1 of this series. Most of the background information needed for the play of this game is contained in Volume 1, and these materials are not repeated here . . . Most of the game information required by the players is given here."

User summary:
The book is divided into the following sections:
2.2 Establishing a character
2.3 Encumbrance and prices
2.4 Character Development
2.5 The Round of Play
2.6 Scales, Terrain and Movement
2.7 "Adventure Actions"
2.8 Combat
2.9 Sorcery

114132.name: Swords and Glory Volume 1: Tékumel Source Book
114132.description:
Excerpt from the introduction:

This volume presents the background materials required for a fantasy role-playing game campaign based upon the world of Tékumel. It is thus a reference work and not a game in itself. This book can be used to enlarge and enhance existing campaigns which employ the game "Empire of the Petal Throne" (by M.A.R. Barker, 1975) or it can be utilised as the foundation for gaming with the revised and rewritten version of this game which will follow as a continuation of this volume.

User summary:
The book is divided into the following sections:
1.1 Astronomical Data
1.2 Early History
1.3 The Historical Empires
1.4 Physical Ethnology
1.5 Family, Lineage and Clan
1.6 Religion and "Magic"
1.7 Social Groups and Institutions
1.8 Organisational Structures
1.9 Customs, Entertainments, Costumes and Weapons
1.10 Knowledge and the Arts
1.11 Pronunciation
1.12 Scripts

114133.name: Ace Lightning (PC and PlayStation 2)
114133.description:
In both the PC and PlayStation 2, the game's plot follows a more detailed plot different from the television show's, but more similar to that of the show's in-universe game. All of the games' cutscenes are shown in the style of a comic strip with speech bubbles. A prologue at the start of the game describes Lord Fear escaping from prison in the Sixth Dimension and stealing the Amulet, but is stopped by Ace and the following fight results in the shattering of the Amulet. Both individuals find a single piece of the Amulet and take there fight to the Carnival of Doom. Ace collects the Amulet pieces scattered around the carnival's nightmarish attractions, fighting such villains as Googler, Lady Illusion, Dirty Rat and his own friend Random Virus who suffers from multiple personality disorder and has two personalities, one good and one evil. Ace eventually confronts Lord Fear in the Haunted House, defeating him and his minions before sending them back to prison using the restored Amulet.

The PC and PlayStation 2 games are almost identical, the PlayStation 2 version having better graphics and two bonus levels. The gameplay for each level is to reach the end and collect an Amulet piece to continue the game. There are four distinct worlds, a circus, a funhouse owned by Lady Illusion, a wild west ghost town, and a medieval castle. The final world leads straight into a boss battle against Lord Fear and others. Each world has two or three levels that are unlocked one after the other, the last level ending with a boss battle against a specific antagonist (e.g. Lady Illusion, Googler, Dirty Rat, Random Virus), an Amulet piece appearing after they are defeated using a repeating technique. The Amulet piece at the end of the each level may only be gained after a task is completed, like defeating enemies or a boss, or collecting enough tokens called Doom Dimes.

Most of the game involves platform jumping or locating keys to new areas that appear as actual keys or as large activation buttons. Combat has two stages. First Ace Lightning will fight with a weapon called the Lightning Lance which can fire out lightning bolts or he can use it strike opponents. The lance has an energy bar which will eventually run out and Ace is forced to use his fists and wrist cannons for combat, his cannons capable of stunning an opponent for a period of time. Ace can power up the Lightning Lance by collecting lightning bolt symbols. When enemies are defeated, they leave behind energy balls that can also replenish the lance. Ace can also gain accessories for a period of time, including an energy drink to heal his life bar, the Shield of Justice which protects him with a force field, and an ability to double jump, as he is unable to fly in the games as he is shown to in the television series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ace Lightning (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114134.name: Pinocchio e il pesce parlante
114134.description:
The game includes a 3D representation of the Pinocchio's world (the village and the sea with the whale).
The players move their pawns to both the mainland and the sea trying to gain gold coins and, in the same time, trying to avoid the various hazards because a player could be eaten by the whale during the game. If the whale was selected, the player should listen to its message (there is a disc in it where there was recorded several sentences) and suffer the consequences.
At the end, the player who will have more gold coins will be the winner.

114135.name: Ace Lightning (Game Boy Advance)
114135.description:
The Game Boy Advance adaption follows the television show's story closely, involving the characters who are from a video game appearing on Earth, and Ace ventures into the Carnival of Doom to find the pieces of the Amulet and defeat Lord Fear, eventually sending the villains back to the Sixth Dimension, the homeworld of the characters.

The gameplay of the Gameboy version is a simple side scroller platform game where a player controls Ace and moves him around the carnival's attractions. At the end of the each level is a piece of the Amulet and a boss battle against an antagonist suited to the environment. The levels are based on attractions that are usually seen in an amusement park of small funfair (e.g. a ghost train, carousel, rollercoaster, etc.), the final level being the Haunted House where Lord Fear is battled. The player can be ambushed by the enemies whilst navigating their way around the carnival, leading to miniature boss battles. Two minigames are unlocked throughout the course of the game, one being a shooting gallery and the other a strength-testing game, where the player has to time Ace when he hits the machine. If he fails, Ace will toss the mallet used into the air, but it will fall down and knock him out.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ace Lightning (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114136.name: Adiboo and the Energy Thieves
114136.description:
Adiboo and the Energy Thieves (known as Adiboo und die Energiediebe in Germany) was released in 2004, published by VU Games and developed by Coktel Vision. A GameCube version was planned but was cancelled.

Source: Wikipedia, "Adiboo and the Energy Thieves", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

The goal of this game is to keep a robot from taking the physical parts (water, rocks, etc.) of a a planet. There are duels with enemies, platform levels, and races that change in difficulty according to the past performance of a player.

114137.name: Fortified Manor 1
114137.description:
Taken from introductory text.

This article describes a large, fortified manor house. It is unnamed and intended to be usable in any fantasy campaign. It is an example of the sort of manor house that might be found on a large, wealthy estate.

114138.name: ADK Tamashii
114138.description:
ADK Tamashi (aka ADK Soul) is a compilation of video games made and released by SNK Playmore in Japan only for the PlayStation 2 console.

It includes 5 arcade/Neo Geo games which were all developed by ADK and published by SNK Playmore. All 5 are 1:1 arcade ports with only one small enhancement in the form of skill lists/move lists for the characters of the fighting games; nothing else was changed. They are all 2D Games and every game is for 1-2 players. The games are not slower or have any glitches the originals didn't have. Ninja Master's: Haō Ninpō Chō was one of the rarest Neo Geo games.

Unlike all the other Japanese versions of Neo Geo game compilations for PS2, it had no online modes.

Source: Wikipedia, "ADK Tamashii", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114139.name: 1761: From Canal to Rail
114139.description:
1761 is a game in the 18xx genre set in England, but the early game is about canals. Only later do the players start operating railways. The main differences from other titles are associated with how the canal companies fade away as the rail companies come to dominate.

The game begins in the Canal Age. In stock rounds, players auction the Private Companies and the Minor Companies. In operating rounds, the Privates pay a fixed income and the Minors lay track, earn revenues, and buy boats.

In due course, the game enters the Railway Age. In stock rounds, players may buy shares in Public Companies (which start as 5-share). In operating rounds, Publics lay track, place station markers, earn revenues, and buy trains. If they have reached their destination, they may grow into a 10-share company. Minors become fixed-income like Privates, and may be acquired by Publics.

The game ends when a Public share price exceeds a certain value. The player with the highest worth (cash + shares) wins.

114140.name: Activity 1997
114140.description: Expansion for the Activity with 110 new cards about what happens in 1997.

114141.description: Expansion for the Activity with 110 new cards about what happens in 1996.
114141.name: Activity 1996

114142.name: Midgard: Grundbox
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114142.description:
User Summary:

In 1986 this boxed set version of the core rules of Midgard (2nd Edition) was released. It contained the book Midgard: Das Fantasy-Rollenspiel (2nd Edition), 3 dice and 5 metal miniatures produced by Hobby Products GmbH.

114143.name: Activity: Alles ist möglich
114143.description: In this version of Activity, the aim of the game is again to explain as many terms as possible to your team and to be the first team to cross the finish line, but there is a special term on each card and it can be explained by using any combination of drawing, pantomime and sound.

114144.name: Activity Celebrations
114144.description: A new version of the classic game, based on the rules of Activity Original 2 and with spezial rules according to the partnership with the sweets manufacturer Masterfood - some words must be described with a mouth full of chocolate. Chocolate is not included, but 5 invitation cards for a games evening! The words on the 200 cards come from the categories cinema and TV, trends and life style, fun and leisure and stars and starlets.

114145.description:
Countdown Activity introduces strengthened conditions for Activity game: The performer for his team starts a timer that counts down the time. If it is possible to guess the word, the timer is stopped and the team may move as many boxes with the character, are indicated on the card. If it becomes clear that the guessing team takes too long, the team can continue to call and stop the timer.
Each team will receive a time credit of three minutes per player, which is input to the timer. Sometimes it is better to give up in order not to waste time unnecessarily.
114145.name: Activity Countdown

114146.name: Insel des Widdergottes
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114146.description:
User Summary:

The second adventure book for the second edition of Midgard contained two adventures:


Insel des Widdergottes (Island of the God Ram) by Bernd Lindenberger
Über den Llemaén-Paß (Over the Llemaén Pass) by Jürgen E. Franke

114147.name: Conquest of the Time Master
114147.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The king's daughter had disappeared into the caverns of time.

Now you must journey through time - to the past and the future to rescue her from the awesome power of the Time Master.

You must choose now - Will you be the Wizard or the Warrior?

As the Wizard, you will take with you the Book of Spells. You will be master of all its mysterious magic.

As the Warrior, you will take the Book of Weapons. Its complete arsenal is yours to use with your legendary skill.

114148.description: Expansion for the Activity but this time the game is played using English vocabulary for I/II grade.
114148.name: Activity for English I/II

114149.name: Die Krone der Drachen (Midgard 2nd Edition)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114149.description:
From the back of the book:

Träge wiegen sich die Fischerboote in der leichten Brise, die um die Mittagszeit eingesetzt hat und die drückende Hitze etwas erträglicher macht. Streunende Katzen streiten sich um die Abfälle des morgendlichen Fischmarkts, während sich die Einwohner Arakossums zur Mittagsruhe in ihre weißen, fensterlosen Häuser zurückgezogen haben. Ihr sitzt auf der Kaimauer und genießt die südländische Idylle. Das eintönige Summen Hunderter von Schmeißfliegen und Mücken, das Glitzern der Sonne auf der Sakajami-Bucht und die Gerüche nach Fisch, Salzwasser und den Gewürzen der ranabarischen Küche versetzen Euch in einen Zustand zufriedener Trägheit. Das Schicksal in Gestalt eines Boten des Stadtfürsten gönnt Euch jedoch keine Ruhe. Die Krone der Drachen ist verschwunden - und Ihr sollt sie zurückholen!

Die Krone der Drachen ist einer der großen Schätze Ranabars. Mit ihrer Hilfe konnten die Krieger des Drachenordens vor mehreren Generationen die Herrschaft der Nagai brechen und diese intelligenten Echsenmenschen in die Tiefen des Urwaldes zurücktreiben. Heute erleichtert das Artefakt den Fürsten von Ranabar, die wilden Riesenechsen des Landes zu zähmen und als Reit- und Arbeitstiere einzusetzen. Die Krone der Drachen ist bei einem Überfall auf eine gut bewachte Karawane verschwunden, und die Spuren der geheimnisvollen Räuber weisen in die Tiefen des Dschungels.

Könnt Ihr den wilden Tieren und den kriegerischen Stämmen des ranabarischen Urwaldes trotzen? Gelingt es Euch, der Spur der Räuber zu folgen und das Geheimnis und das spurlose Verschwinden der Krone der Drachen zu entschlüsseln?

Die Krone der Drachen ist ein spielbereites, reich bebildertes Abenteuer für MIDGARD und andere Fantasy-Rollenspiele mit Karten, illustrativen Grundrissen und ausführlichen Erläuterungen für den Spielleiter.


Translation:

Slow the fishing boats sway in the breeze that started around noon and makes the oppressive heat a little more bearable. Stray cats are arguing over the waste of the morning fish market, while the inhabitants of Arakossum have withdrawn to nap in their white, windowless houses. You sit on the pier and enjoy the Mediterranean idyll. The monotonous hum of hundreds of flies and mosquitoes, the glint of sun on the Sakajami Bay and the smells of fish, salt water and the spices in the ranabarian cuisine put you into a happy state of dullness. But fate in the guise of a messenger of the city prince doesn't grant you a rest. The Crown of the Dragons is gone - and you shall get it back!

The Crown of the Dragons is one of the great treasures Ranabars. With its help several generations ago the Warriors of the Dragon were able to break the reign of Nagai and repel these intelligent lizard man into the depths of the jungle. Today, the artifact facilitates the princes of Ranabar to tame the wild giant lizards of the country and use them as riding and draft animals. The Crown of the Dragons is gone in a raid on a well-guarded caravan, and the traces of the mysterious robber are pointing in the depths of the jungle.

Can you brave the wild animals and the warlike tribes of the ranabarian jungle? Will you follow the trail of the robbers and solve the mystery and the disappearance of the Crown of the Dragons?
The Crown of the Dragons is a game-ready, richly illustrated adventure for MIDGARD and other fantasy role-playing games with cards, illustrative floor plans and detailed explanations for the game master.

114151.name: OPFOR Tactical OPs
114151.description:
This solitaire game is inspired by the work of the World Class OPFOR of the U.S. Army. In the game, you are a Colonel of a Brigade Combat Team trying to drive through OPFOR forces into the enemy rear. If you are sufficiently successful, you may be promoted to General. If not, you could lose your command.
To play, 9 OPFOR defense cards are played facedown in a 3X3 pattern. The player then selects from a variety of FRAGO cards which offensive operation he wants to use to find a path thru the defensive lines. Each FRAGO lists the type of operation, combat strength, and the number of game-hours to complete the operation. The player has to find, or fight, his way thru the defense in less than 20 game-hours.
If the player completes the breakthrough in less than 20 game-hours, he retains his command. If he can do it in 16 or less game-hours, he is promoted. If it takes longer than the alloted time, the player loses command.

114153.name: Huracans Heimkehr
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114153.description:
From the back of the book:

Huracan! Ah, das ist ein Höllenweib! Allein ihr Anblick kann einen Mann schon den Verstand kosten. Aber lass nur die Finger von ihr, wenn Du nicht mehr verlieren willst als dieser Klotz von einem walischen Barbaren, der sie für eines von Minairius leichten Mädchen hielt. Völlig unberechenbar, arrogant und tödlich wie eine Smaragdviper, dieses Weib. Weißt Du, wie sie zu ihrem Namen gekommen ist? - Ja, Huracan ist nicht ihr richtiger Name. Sie ist eine dieser Primitiven, die auf den Vulkaninseln weit im Süden hausen und deren Namen kein zivilisierter Mensch aussprechen kann. Ihren Namen hat sie auf Huanaca erhalten, wo sie sich einige Jahre herumgetrieben hat. Huracan heißt "Wirbelsturm" in der Sprache der Huas, und so wild und vernichtend soll sie bei der Auslöschung einer Räuberbande gekämpft haben, die ein Bauerndorf terrorisiert hatte. Eine normale Frau würde sich nie den Lebensunterhalt mit der Waffe verdienen.

Ähnliche Geschichten kann man in vielen Städten Südagenirons hören. Ihr kennt Huracan aber besser und wisst, dass sie hilfsbereit und zuverlässig ist, wenn man erst einmal ihre Freundschaft gewonnen hat. Jetzt plant die Abenteurerin, in ihre Heimat zurückzukehren, um dort das Schicksal ihrer Blutsschwester zu ergründen. Seid ihr bereit, Sie auf diese weite und gefahrvolle Reise zu begleiten, einer Reise, die Euch bis ins Schwarze Herz der Finsternis und darüber hinaus führen wird? Seid ihr der Achtung Huracans und des Danks der Lichtgötter würdig? Gelingt es Euch, Huracans Blutsschwester vor den Machenschaften der Diener des Schwarzen Herzens zu bewahren? Oder schrecken Euch die Erzählungen von einer wilden, fremdenfeindlichen Steinzeitkultur, deren finstere Priester über aus gigantischen Steinblöcken geformte Kultstätten gebieten?

Huracans Heimkehr ist ein spielbereites, reich bebildertes Abenteuer für Midgard und andere Fantasy-Rollenspiele mit Karten, illustrativen Grundrissen und ausführlichen Erläuterungen für den Spielleiter.


Translation:

Huracan! Ah, that's a Höllenweib! Her sight alone can already cost a man his mind. But let's just stay away from her if you want to lose no more than this chump of a Walian barbarian, who took her for one of Minairius' girls. Totally unpredictable, arrogant and deadly as an emerald viper, this woman. You know how she got her name? - Yes, Huracan is not her real name. She is one of these primitives who live on the volcanic islands far to the south and whose names no civilized human being can pronounce. The name she has received on Huanaca, where she has been hanging around for a few years. Huracan means "whirlwind" in the language of Hua's, and so wild and destructive it is said she fought in the extinction of a gang of robbers which have had terrorized a farming village. A normal woman would never earn a living with a weapon.

Similar stories can be heard in many cities of southern Ageniron. But you know Huracan better and know that she is helpful and reliable once you have won her friendship. Now the adventures is planning to return to her homeland in order to investigate the fate of her blood sister. Are you ready to accompany her on this long and perilous journey, a journey that you will lead you into the black heart of darkness and beyond? Are you worthy of respect of Huracan and the gratitude of the gods of light? Will you succeed in keeping Huracan's blood sister from the machinations of the servants of the Black Heart? Or do the stories of a wild, xenophobic Stone Age culture, whose dark priest rule about places of Worship shaped of huge stone blocks, scare you?

Huracan is a ready to play, richly illustrated adventure for Midgard, and other fantasy role-playing games with cards, illustrative floor plans and detailed explanations for the game master.

114154.name: Anima Tactics: Church Agent
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114154.description:
Church Agent's are the special forces available to the Churches
highest circles of power. Many have been trained in Caedus since childhood to hunt down and destroy the forces that threaten humanity, while others learn to use the divine gifts they where born with to further the Churches work. While they come from disparate walks of life, every church agent has been drawn to the fold to become an instrument of their god's will on Gaia.


Neutral Church Warrior or Mystic - Lv. 20+
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 10 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Agent: Church Agents are not unique characters and you may include 1 for every 150 Levels in a Church Alliance Party. For example, a party of 300 levels could include up to two Church Agents.
ooo - Deus Ex Terra (Ki, Attack)
+3 Attack / +2 Damage. Deus Ex Terra can only be used if the Agent is a Warrior.
ooo - Healing (Magic, Effect)
A friendly Character within the Agent's Control Zone is healed 2 Life Points. Healing can only be used if the Agent is a Mystic.

Church Agent Skill Card
A Church Agent can possess any combination of the following options, as long the added levels do not take their total level above 40. Any option cannot be chosen more than once. Options from the Inquisitor section of this card cannot be chosen if any options from the Saint section are chosen and vice versa.
•The Agent recovers one more Action per turn. Lv. +10
•The Agent's Speed is increased to 8/12. Lv. +5
Inquisitor
•The Agent's attacks against Light Characters get +4 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent's attacks against Dark Characters get +4 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent's attacks against Mystic Characters get +4 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent gets +1 attack and +2 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent gets +4 Life Points. Lv. +5
Saint
•The Agent's Healing skill heals 5 Life Points instead of 2. Lv. +10
•Innate Ability: All Friendly Characters in the Agent's Control Zone get +1 Resistance. Lv +10
•The Agent gets the following ability: Lv. +5
oo - Holy Protection (Magic, Effect)
A Friendly Character with the Control Zone of the Agent gets Shield Lv.1 and Protection Lv.1.
Alignment: If options from the Inquisitor section are chosen, then the Agent is Dark faction and a Warrior. If options from the Saint section are chosen, then the Agent is Light faction and a Mystic. If no options are chosen from either section, the Agent is Neutral and you decide whether they are either a Warrior or Mystic.

114155.description: Expansion for the Activity. 110 new cards for the base game.
114155.name: Activity Zusatzkarten

114156.name: Anima Tactics: Lilith
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114156.description:
Even in a world such as Gaia, that holds so many secrets, Lilith is a mysterious enigma. Though she is an influential and powerful member of the 7th Heaven Knights her name is largely unknown as she mostly operates behind the scenes. As a mere human born into a world that humanity could consider hellish, Lilith has learned has become more adept at magic than many archmages and trained her fighting skills to a level rarely attained in an attempt to shield humanity from the darkness.

Light Empire Leader Mystic Warrior - Lv. 75
At 6 | Dm 5 | Df 9/11 | Ar 3 | LP 16 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 4/5
Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery, Initiative.
Swirling Blades: Lilith uses her secondary Defense value against Ranged Attacks.
oo - Alraune (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inches). If you score a Critical Hit with this Attack, you may move the target into contact with Lilith's base, moving them in a straight line. This move ignores intervening obstacles. Effect 18.
ooo - Scorpion Blade (Ki, Attack)
When rolling for this Attack, roll two dice and keep the highest result. This Attack affects all enemy units within 2 inches of Lilith.
oooo - Dream of Lust (Ki, Attack)
+3 Damage (Both Attacks). Lilith makes 2 consecutive Attacks against the same target.
Archmage
Once per turn, Lilith may use one of the following abilities:
o - Healing Light (Magic, Effect)
A friendly unit within Lilith's Control Zone recovers 3 Life Points.
o - Spy Light (Magic, Seek)
+3 to the Seek roll, During the Seek action of this ability, Lilith's Control Zone is increased by 4 inches.
o - Protection (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
A friendly unit within Lilith's Control Zone gets Protection lv. 2
oo - Blessing (Magic, Effect )
Friendly units within Lilith's Control Zone gain +1 to Attack and +1 Defense. Upkeep: o

114157.name: Anima Tactics: Tiamat
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114157.description:
"Unique" is the best way to describe Tiamat, the youngest of the four 7th Heaven Knights that serves Elisabetta Bardados. A lazy womanizer, but with a god like talent for fighting is also another way. Making him sit up and take things seriously is the last thing his enemies would ever want.

Neutral Empire Optional Leader Warrior/Prowler - Lv. 60
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 10 | Ar 2 | LP 15 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/5
Innate Abilities: Initiative
Cancer: Tiamat can make melee Attacks on targets within 4 inches of himself. Charges are not affected by this ability.
ooo - Awe of the Forgotten (Ki, Attack)
This attack rolls 2 dice and keeps the highest. If this Attack causes damage, its target suffers Seal Lv. 1. Effect 16.
oo - World of Wires (Ki, Effect)
Move an enemy unit within Tiamat’s Control Zone 4 inches in the direction of your choice. This ability can be used to move Characters Engaged in Combat. Effect 15.
o - Wires of Destiny (Ki, Effect)
Tiamat gains Haste Lv. 3. Limit: Once per game.
His true power…
Optional Leader: You may choose to use this skill card when you include Tiamat in your group. If you do, Tiamat gets +5 Levels, has the abilities on this card, and is a Leader.
Perfect Defense: While Tiamat hasn’t moved during a turn, all Ranged Attacks that target him automatically miss and no roll is made for them. Once Tiamat has moved during a turn, this ability won’t have any affect until the beginning of the next turn.
ooo - Starlight Romance (Ki, Effect)
All enemy units within Tiamat’s Control Zone suffer Paralyze Lv. 1. Effect: 15.
Limit: Once per game.

114158.description: Expansion for the Activity. 110 new cards for the base game with theme The Seventies!
114158.name: Activity Die siebziger Jahre! Zusatzkarten

114159.name: Celebrations Activity Mini Edition
114159.description: Activity advertising mini-version produced for Masterfoods who is known many confectionery products.

114160.description:
Another promotional version of Activity for Kelly's.
This is pocket edition of Activity task cards only.
114160.name: Kelly's Activity pocket

114161.description:
Expansion for the game Erwischt
87 new missions for the base game
114161.name: Erwischt Zusatzkarten

114162.name: Slot Machine
114162.description:
In-app description:

Spin the wheels and take your chances. Bet big or small and build your winnings. Play alone or against a friend.

User Summary

Slot Machine is a simulation of a simple fruit machine for the Atari 2600.

Each player (or the computer and player) are given 25 coins each, and the game ends when one player's coins reaches zero.

The aim is to score the most points, see below.

There are eight game modes made up of any combination of the following:


One or Two Players
Jackpot Game or Payoff Game
Center Pay Line or Up to 5 Pay Lines


The Jackpot Game has just three winning combinations, which can score 20, 100 or 200 points.

The Payoff Game has ten different winning combinations, scoring from 2 to 200 points.

A player can stake from 1 to 5 coins. When playing with the "Center Pay Line" option, the stake acts as a multiplier - if you get a winning combination, then the win is multiplied by your stake. When playing with "Up to 5 Pay Lines", each additional coin activates an additional potential Pay Line, therefore increasing the chance of a winning combination. The five possible Pay Lines are the three horizontal lines of symbols, plus the two diagonals.

114163.name: Stellar Track
114163.description:
In-App summary:

As ship commander navigate the galaxy destroying enemy ships, but watch your fuel and torpedo supply!

From the manual:

It is 2000 years since the unification of our planet and we "Terrans" have peacefully excelled in art, philosophy and science. Our technology has mastered all but one problem, the hyperwarp drive (which would enable us to travel to other planets). Trapped in our own solar system for lack of the hyperwarp drive, there seems to be no way out until we are discovered by extraterrestrial life. These "Aliens" are anxious to trade their hyperwarp technology for Terran art and science to revitalize their stagnant culture.

As time passes, we Terrans expand our empire through interstellar trade and the use of hyperwarp technology. Increasingly the Terrans and Aliens compete over the riches in the universe. We develop phased energy weapons (PHASORS) and force shields, while the Aliens insist on escorting their merchant envoys with warships. Tension begins to grow.

The Terran government directed by the House of Viceroys, decides to build an indestructible Starfleet and two Galactic Starbases to insure cosmic military supremacy. With the invention of a deadly photon-launcher and the virtual invisibility of the starbases (their location is a closely guarded secret), we Terrans feel that a single Super Warship can keep the scattered Alien fleet in check. You are the captain and sole commander of that warship.

While the Viceroys are relaxing and confident of our military superiority, the Alien Council of Elders rule that the Terran culture has to be destroyed. This is to be done before Alien dominance in the heavens is lost. As the Terran Starship Commander, you must throw back the Alien invasion.

114164.name: Push-Cars
114164.description:
Welcome to Push-Cars, the new and addictive puzzle game where the good and eco friendly cars leave the cities while the bad and polluting ones keep on crashing!

★ ENJOY THE TRIP.
Help Sparky and his friends to exit the city in the search of fresh air and see how Hannibal and the most dirty cars crash and pollute the real streets from New York to Las Vegas, visiting Washington, Miami, Houston, Chicago, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Hollywood along the way.

★ ONLY ONE FINGER TO CONTROL, ALL YOUR BRAIN TO WIN.
With a brand new game idea, Push-Cars will have you hooked with its irresistible gameplay. You only have to use one finger to position the cars in the desired direction and hit PLAY to make them move and clear each level. Easy to play, but with a smooth difficulty curve that will keep you craving for more! There is more than one way to resolve each level, but only one will give you the three wheels of fame!

★ INCREDIBLY EASY TO PLAY. BUT SURPRISINGLY CHALLENGING.
"This car has only 3 possible orientations and none of them work!"

These are some phrases that you probably will say to yourself when you discover the funny levels of Push-cars. Seems trivial, but it sure will surprise you.

★ NO TIME FOR BORING.
✓ 90 Challenging levels based on authentic American cities.
✓ Unique puzzle gameplay.
✓ Retina display graphics.
✓ 9 Different cars with different behavior.
✓ Easy to play, difficult to master.
✓ Unique achievements with game center integration.
✓ Exclusive music theme.
✓Game Center, Facebook and Twitter integration.

Source: The Game Website.

114165.name: Age of Wind
114165.description:
Get ready for exciting adventures on the sea full of dangers and opportunities! Become the captain of a sailing ship! Explore new islands, fight in naval battles, trade exotic goods!

You are the captain of warship from Dominican. After an unsuccessful battle far from mother island, you are on the other side of the world with little money, which just enough for small ships. Now everything depends on you! Will you be able to return home on warships or will disappear in the depths of the sea in one of the bloodiest battles.

The closer you move to mother island, the stronger the opponent. Large fleet can not be defeated only through a powerful weapon very important to actively maneuver, deviating from enemy shots. To make an accurate shot, must turn to the enemy by any board and tap anywhere on the screen. It should not allow the enemy a chance to shoot at your ship.

In combat, the ship is almost always gets some damage. This does not degrade its seaworthy qualities, but can cause death during the battle. Watch to it that your battleship was repaired. You can repair the ship at the nearest island, of course not for free.

Good warship is costly. Earn money in three ways:
- You can rob the caravans. If you win you get all the goods that a ship carries. Goods can be sold on the market nearest island.
- You can win sea battles. In addition to the trophy goods, you get a little cash bonus.
- You can engage in peaceful trade. Prices of goods are quite different. Sometimes peaceful trade brings in more revenue than robbery.

At the beginning of the game you play on one of the easiest ships. She has a few guns, low speed and small hold – it is poorly suited for both war and trade. Fortunately for any island has a wide selection of more advanced ships, which you can buy. When buying a ship, pay attention to the speed of the ship, number and power of guns, the volume of the hold.

In addition to purchasing a new vehicle, you can always improve an existing one. There are three types of improvements:
- Guns – increases the power of kernels and slightly reduces the recharge time.
- Armor – reduces the chance of the enemy to cause damage to your ship.
- Sails – increases the speed of the ship.

Control:
- To turn the ship – tilt iphone in the right direction.
- To shoot – tap anywhere on the screen.
- To see a map – tap on the compass.

Features include:
- 15 unique ships;
- 20 unique islands;
- 30 unique battles;
- a world full of dangers and adventures.

Source: The Developer Website.

114166.name: 2XL Supercross
114166.description:
"2XL Supercross HD" is an all-new offroad racing experience from the creative team that brought you such popular hits as: Motocross Madness, ATV Offroad Fury and MX Unleashed.

Key Features:
- Supercross and Freestyle tracks designed by Motocross champion Stephane Roncada
- 3 modes of play: Time Trials, Practice and Racing
- 4 player Wi-Fi or 2 player Bluetooth multiplayer
- Ride 125cc, 250cc and 450cc bikes
- Select your appearance from hundreds of different bike and rider combinations
- Race with up to 8 bikes and riders
- 4 camera views including first person with handle bars
- Select from 8 preset control schemes
- Responsive tilt steering interface with tunable sensitivities
- Adjustable level of difficulty
- Statistics tracking with web-based community and rankings

Source: The Game Website.

114167.name: Bone Mountain
114167.description:
From the Lulu description:

For Classic adventure systems, levels 4-6. "Legends speak of a mountain rich in treasure, where gold nuggets lay on the surface waiting to be claimed. But do you and your friends have the curiosity to seek out the mountain to see if the stories are true?"

114168.name: Tex Willer
114168.description:
Board game inspired by the famous comic Tex Willer.
The game is 3D so, before to start, the players must to install on board: Saloon, General Store, Indian camp and a Mountain.
Divided into two groups, gunslingers and natives, the players will roll the dice to move on the path while the duels will be solved with a special dice. In the game there are also two decks of cards, one for each group, to influence the game with some unforeseen.
Winner is the first to arrive in the hamlet opponent.

114169.name: Shuffle Penny Plus
114169.description: Each player shuffles five pennies from the base line. Each penny scores the highest scoring ring it touches. Total score doubles if penny goes into the center hole. Maximum score is 250.

114170.name: The Word Game
114170.description:
The Word Game is played by placing pennies on the board as each player spells words until one player wins. 24 pennies are needed to play. One player plays heads, the other plays tails.

Players flip a penny to start. Players spell words by covering each letter in the word being spelled. A consonant may only be played once unless it appears more than once in the word being played. Vowels may be played more than once, but only if your opponent's coin is showing. If playing a vowel previously played by your opponent, simply flip the coin over.

The last player to make a word of two or more letters wins. Or, when all possible letters are played, the player with the most pennies wins.

114171.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 2 - Dec 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Chronopia Conversion - Dwarf Dark Tusk Standard
Terraforming in Miniature - The Sea Wall
The Nefertem - A New Army for Cronopia
114171.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

114172.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 3 - Mar 2001)
rpgissuearticle: The Slave Pit - Dwarf Wolf Totem
114172.description:
Cover by Jim Callahan

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

114173.description:
Ever wanted to be a super-villain? Now you can! Make a play for sectors of the city and be the big Boss... but that pesky Now, you can be the criminal mastermind an entire city fears and despises.

Villains! the Board Game is a unique and thrilling adventure where you play as one of four super-villains on their quest for city-wide domination.

Play as the Mad Genius, the Alien Emperor, the Crime Lord, or the Eccentric Sociopath! Your hand of cards is full of tools you can use to defeat your enemies -- Goods and Allies, Wicked Plots, and Loot that allows you to hire a dazzling array of Henchmen and have them battle for supremacy over sectors of the city.

But beware--the city is protected by the Hero, and he gets his own try at defeating the most powerful Villain. Can you lure the Hero into a Trap by using his Girlfriend or Sidekick as bait? Will the Hero fall prey to his own Weakness?

The game itself is one of Area Control, reaping benefits from each particular sector of the city while strategically using these benefits to procure what you need to win.
114173.name: Villains!

114174.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 4 - Jun 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Chronopia Battle Report - Devout vs. House Helios Elves
Miniature Review - Wizards of the Coast
New Unit - The T.A.V. for Warhammer 40k
The Slave Pit - Dwarf Wolf Totem
114174.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

114175.name: Super Baseball
114175.description:
In-app description:

Atari's final baseball game for the Atari 2600, a follow-up to RealSports Baseball.

From the back of the box:

Hit a Homer!

It's the bottom of the ninth, the bases are loaded, and you're up at bat! The visiting team is ahead by three runs. You already have three balls and two strikes, and this next pitch looks like a mean curve. Should you swing on could this be ball four and a free walk to first?

Super Baseball brings the plays and thrills of real baseball to your video screen! As the batter, you can take extra bases or play it safe. As the pitcher, you can throw curves, screwballs, fast-balls, or change-up pitches. As the outfielder, you can move around the field to catch the ball and make putouts.

You will have full control over all men on the field. So get out there and "Play Ball!"

114176.name: EZ Hero (Issue 1 - March/April 2000)
114176.description:
In this issue:

Regular columns, plus... How to Succeed in Gaming, Long Range Planning, Good Gaming, Fiction to Function, Champions Tips and Tricks, Accessible Gaming, EZ Places (Maps), Unusual Suspects (Characters), EZ Cutouts (Drawings), & Chumpions (Humor).

114177.name: Super Football
114177.description:
In-app description:

Atari's final football game for the Atari 2600, featuring updated plays and a perspective view.

From the manual:

Super Football offers 3-D football action. On screen you get a full view of the field from above and behind the offensive team. And you control the action as the players line up, kick, run, pass and score.

You can play Super Football on any one of four game levels. As you advance to higher levels, game play lasts longer and the action heats up. You'll even select formations and patterns to run the game your way. To win, your five-player team has to score more points than your opponent's, with touchdowns, extra points, and field goals.

During game play, the clock runs continuously. There are no time-outs, fumbles penalties, safeties, or running out of bounds in Super Football, so your game continues uninterrupted while you rack up points.

With Super Football, it's nonstop gridiron action until the final whistle!

114178.name: Really Big Sky
114178.description:
REALLY BIG SKY! A super fast, twin analogue shooter for the modern age!

Way over in the big void of space live some aliens. They coveted [your planet] and would do anything to live there themselves. So what's [your planet] to do? Yeah, blast through them all! Face off against waves of enemies, bosses, big laser planets, blackholes, wormholes, giant lasers, planets and asteroids across 12 game modes!

Everything is procedurally generated from the way YOU play the game, from attack patterns, strength of bosses and enemies, pacing between waves, generosity of bonuses... etc!

Features a comprehensive statistics system to let you hone your mad laser skills!

Source: The Developer Website.

114179.name: Video Checkers
114179.description:
In-app description:

Play the classic board game head-to-head vs. computer. Or play "give-away" and win by being the first to lose!

114180.name: Supersonic
114180.description:
Supersonic is an adrenaline-charged, music-driven 3D ride game. The players blaze through radiant neon racing circuits at ever faster speeds, accompanied by electronic beats from Finnish artist collective Kitkaliitto. Cutting edge riders can compete for a place on the weekly Top 50 list. The ultimate challenge comes in the 30-second Blitz mode with speed boosts, time extends and other special collectibles.

Supersonic is created by Janne Piekkola and published by Kuuasema. It's currently available for Android, iOS and WebOS.

Source: The Game Website.

114181.name: EZ Hero (Issue 2 - May/June 2000)
114181.description:
User Summary

“Weapons and Armor" theme issue

Includes regular articles plus... Weapons and Wielders, The Armor of God, GURPS to HERO System, Military Hero, EZ Places (Maps), Unusual Suspects (Characters), EZ Cutouts (Drawings), & Chumpions (Humor).

114182.name: EZ Hero (Issue 3 - July/August 2000)
114182.description:
User Summary

THE READY-TO-GAME ISSUE special double-sized convention issue

In this issue regular articles plus... The Thieves' Crown, The Golden General, Project: PREDATOR, Operation: Tonsil, Cutout Heroes (Drawings), & Chumpions (Humor).

114183.name: EZ Hero (Issue 4 - Sept/Oct 2000)
114183.description:
User Summary

THE BAD GUY ISSUE

In this issue regular articles, plus... The Cemetery Gates; Anarchy International; Less Angst, More Bullets; Order of the Bone-Magi; Homicide; A Fine Place to Die; & Cutout Heroes (Drawings).

114184.name: Pallina
114184.description:
From the outside box: Be careful when pulling out these sticks! With Pallina you need a very sensitive touch and thoughtful strategy. Excitement and challenge awaits young players!

Gameplay: A variant of Ker-plunk. Game contains four colors of bamboo sticks and 16 wooden balls, also in four colors. The sticks are placed between the holes of a bamboo funnel shaped basket. Next the balls are mixed and inserted into the basket. In turn, players pull out a stick of their color, trying to keep their colored balls from falling to the bottom (but it is ok if other colored balls fall). The player who has the last ball of their color in the upper basket wins. Two players use two colors, three or four players use one color.

114185.description:
A pack of 6 promo cards that were designed and offered during D-Day Dice's 2011 Kickstarter campaign. All these cards are themed around the Kickstarter concept, and focus on resource sharing or giving. For example, the Supporter Specialist allows a Unit to give resources to any other Unit on the map, and the Victory Ribbon gives every Unit 1 free Specialist.

The cards of the K-Pack are:

Pledge Ribbon (Award)
Victory Ribbon (Award)
Campaign Ribbon (Award)
K-Gun (Regular Item)
K-Rations (Regular Item)
Supporter (Unique Specialist)
114185.name: D-Day Dice: K-Pack
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

114186.description:
Game is based on the format of a hugely successful gameshow in Britain. The show ran from 1978 to 1988. The host throughout was comedian Ted Rogers (1935 - 2001), pictured on the cover.

With the help of cryptic clues, players must solve them (and more routine quiz questions), and to thus eliminate other players from the game.

The TV show's star was Dusty Bin (also on the cover), a cartoon dustbin. If you failed to win a big prize all you got was a ceramic Dusty Bin figure.

114187.name: I Can Spy
114187.description:
Game intended to keep the kids quiet on a long car journey.

Each child gets a different card which has various images on it. The players must observe each item on their card. As they are seen, they are ticked off using the special crayons in the box. The boards are laminated so that any marks can be rubbed off, making sure that the game can be played again on the next journey.

There are 9 images on each board, so the first to spot all 9 on their particular board, wins. I guess, if the journey finishes before the game, the one with the most successful observations up to that point, wins.

114188.description:
Sploof is a four-in-a-row style game for two players with a Shibumi set. Players have limited resources available and are faced with a choice between positioning balls for strategic effect; or stockpiling them to avoid forced moves later in the game.

Aim: The player who manages to create a string of 4 touching balls at any level visible as a straight line from directly above the board wins the game. In addition, if a player has no balls remaining in their stock and cannot legally remove a red ball they lose the game.

Rules: The board starts with twelve red balls placed around the perimeter of the board. Two players, White and Black, start the game with two balls of their colour in their ‘stock’, the remaining balls are kept in a central ‘supply’. A player's stock must not be hidden from their opponent.

Randomly determine a start player. On their turn a player must either:

- Place a ball on either an empty board hole or stack it on any 2x2 platform of existing balls, or

- Remove a red ball from the board returning it to the supply and move two balls of their colour from the supply to their stock.

The removal of red balls and placement of black and white balls follows Shibumi stacking in that balls may only stack on 2x2 platforms of existing balls and if a red ball is removed then any others that it supports will drop. A red ball that directly supports two or more on the level above is pinned and cannot be removed.

Managing the numbers of balls in your stock is vital for ensuring your opponent does not force you into making moves that do not improve your position. Running out of balls in your stock will force you to remove a red ball and give the opponent two consecutive placements: this becomes a progressively riskier tactic as the game develops.

THE SHIBUMI CHALLENGE

Sploof was created as part of the Shibumi Challenge and was judged to be the winning entry.

The Shibumi Challenge geeklist: Winners announced!

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
114188.name: Sploof

114189.name: 'Over a Thousand' Question Quiz
boardgameimplementation: Tell Me: The Grand Quiz Game
114189.description:
British game made by Peter Pan Playthings to compete with the Spear's game Tell Me: The Grand Quiz Game. Like the Spear's game, this has a spinner, which you use to generate the letter that the answer must begin with. But this game also has a second spinner (instead of cards as in Tell Me), which generates the question.

You get various discs which can change the results of the question spinner. The six discs relate to the subjects of Sport, Nature, Personal, Geography, General Knowledge (1) and General Knowledge (2).

The first to reach a pre-decided number of correct answers, wins.

114190.name: Take Over
114190.description:
In business, a take over is the purchase of one company by another (the acquirer or bidder), usually the first competitor.
Each player represents a major European businessman at the head of an industrial empire.
Each industrial group will try to grow placing factories on the map of the European nations and by selling its products on markets. The players will try to win the position of economic dominance in Europe buying companies of the opponents (Take Over).
The winner will be the owner of three different markets.

114192.name: Gypsy Tips
114192.description:
From the introduction:

The Gypsy is a class intended for advanced players. It puts the impetus on the player to draft an effective Deck of Divination and select auguries that support their playstyle. Here are a few tips to help you get the most out of your gypsy.

114194.description:
Objective: be the first saving your (3) ice bears by bringing them back to the arctic pole
- moving by turn/'Roll & Move' game -
Each player throws a 6-sided-die ('6' is replaced by a balloon)
and moves one of his/her (3) ice bears into the direction of the balloon according the rolled number; if number and distance are matching, step into the balloon - if not (too far) take another bear or miss one turn;
if the die shows the balloon move it 1 step ahead.
If the balloon reaches the pole before one of the players has saved his/her 3 bears all players loose the game
114194.name: Kleiner Eisbär komm doch mit!

114195.name: Crisis Dice
114195.description:
Crisis Dice is a cold war dice game with complexity more akin to 'Zombie dice' than 'Twilight Struggle'.

Crisis Dice is a very light, quick-playing, low-complexity game for 1-2 players aged 8 and up.It lasts between 15 to 20 minutes and emulates a tiny portion of the tension and political unrest between the former Soviet Union and the United States of America during the month of October in 1962.

In this game players will try to infiltrate the heart of their opponent’s government and in doing so gain military intelligence that will help prevent political tension, misunderstanding and ultimately a nuclear war. A peaceful victory with propaganda bonuses is the preferred outcome for either side.

Be the first super power to place their Event Marker onto the Victory space at the end of the Event Track before the opposition and before the DEFCON level reaches one.

Rules summary.....

1. Roll for initiative. Both sides roll a single 6 sided dice the highest score wins initiative for that turn.

2. Place Agency Focus Marker. The winner of the initiative roll chooses one of the four Agency Focus Actions at the top of his side of the game board and moves his Agency Focus Marker from its agency home space to the chosen action space. These bonuses are added to the Spy Dice rolls in the next part of the turn where a score of 5 or 6 is deemed successful. The player that lost initiative then chooses his action (he may not duplicate the action chosen by the winner of initiative for that turn) and places his marker.

3. Roll Spy Dice. Both sides roll all of their available coloured Spy Dice. Dice that have been placed within the Kremlin or The White House during previous turns may not be rolled again and remain where they are until the end of that round. On turn one both players will have 3 dice to roll.

4. Agency Focus bonuses are applied. The chosen Agency Focus Bonus is applied to any one of the rolled Spy Dice, starting with the player who won initiative in step one.

5. Spies infiltrate places of power. Successful spies (those dice that scored a roll of 5 or 6 with any bonuses applied) are deemed to have successfully infiltrated their chosen place of power i.e. Kremlin for U.S. spies or The White House for soviet spies and are placed into the appropriate area on the game board.

6. Repeat steps 1 to 5. These steps are repeated 3 times or until either player has placed all 3 of his spies into the appropriate spy placement area. The first player to do this is deemed the winner of that round and moves his Event Marker one place closer to the Victory space. Players must raise DEFCON level by 1 if indicated by text above event track. If both players fail to place all 3 of their spies into their appropriate spy placement areas then an intelligence stalemate is declared and the DEFCON Marker is raised one level.

7. Return Spies and Agency Focus Markers. All 3 Spy Dice are returned to each player and the Agency Focus Markers are returned to their Agency Home Space ready for the next round.

8. Repeat steps 1 to 7 until one side places their Event Marker onto the Victory space and reads the printed outcome or until the DEFCON level reaches one indicating the start of a worldwide thermo nuclear war and both sides lose.

114196.name: December 2011: The Safehouse
114196.description:
From Introduction:

The Safehouse

The survivors decide to create a safehouse that can provide shelter should the characters get stranded outside their Stronghold. The Safehouse can serve a number of purposes depending how it's stocked and supplied as well as how frequently it is used.

114197.name: The Guild Companion (Dec 2011)
rpgissuearticle: The Art of Fighting Section 9: Vis - Part 1

114198.name: Jonas On Tour CD Board Game
114198.description:
This is a game about the Jonas Brothers singing group.

The object of the game is to gather autographed pictures of the boys. Players representing fans move around a star-shaped pathway while tokens representing the Jonas kids jump across the interior spaces.

Includes a colorful board, the CD tokens, cards, rules, and a storage insert.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players ages 8 or older.

114200.name: The Fallen Fane
114200.description:
From the publishers description:

This adventure is designed for First Edition Advanced Rules. With minor modifications it can be used with any fantasy role playing system (OD&D, Holmes, Moldvay-Cook-Marsh, Mentzer) It is meant for a party of 6 to 9 characters of levels 4th to 8th, which should include at least 1 cleric and magic-user of 5th to 7th level. Centuries past a woodland faun became obsessed with a forest nymph. Kidnapping her, he took her deep into the heart of an ancient wood where he found the ruins of a fallen fane. When the nymph's people came to rescue her the faun prayed to the deity of the ruins for help, but was tricked. Now the faun's petrified body rests within the ruins, awaiting to be rejoined with its spirit.

114201.name: Campaign 2: The Pirates of Drinax
114201.description:
From the website:

In The Pirates of Drinax, the players play a band of adventures who are entrusted by the King of Drinax with a letter of marque, permitting them to prey on 'illegal' trade within the borders of the vanished kingdom. The King hopes that this piracy will give him the leverage he needs to restore Drinax to its former glory, and intends for the characters to win back all the planets lost over the last two centuries - but the King's plans are just the starting point for this campaign.

Once the characters have their letter and their ship, it's up to the players for what to do next. Will they stay loyal to their patron and help restore Drinax? Will they turn rogue and create their own kingdom? Will they be heroes or monsters, pirates or privateers? Will they make their fortune amid the pitiless stars, or will the cold depths of the Trojan Reach be their grave?

Table of Contents

Introduction
Key Ports
1. Honour Among Thieves
2. Treasure Ship
3. Ihatei!
4. The Demon's Eye
5. The Treasure of Sindal

admin comment
this entry will be complete after the 10 sections are released

114202.name: Dartabout
114202.description:
The introduction to the rule book says "'DARTABOUT' is a really good game and one which we feel sure will be universally popular. .. it has only five simple rules of play .. The object of the game is for each player to move his five men across the board from his own 'starts' and occupy the 'starts' of the player opposite to him, doing as much 'damage' to his opponents as is compatible with skilful play."

As with the same maker's Sorry!, pieces are moved via playing cards. Some ('straight') cards move a piece forwards so many squares, other ('bent') cards mean the piece must make a 90 degree turn as part of its move. Three special cards exist: '69' can be treated either as a straight six or a bent nine; '8' allow two pieces to be moved a combined total of eight spaces forward; and '1' allows a piece to move one square forwards or sideways. Opposing pieces not on safety square which are landed on are 'bumped' off onto an unfavourable start square.

The main game involves dealing out the deck between the players who can then pick which card to play each turn. If the game has not finished, the discards are shuffled and dealt again. A version for children involves picking cards at random to play each turn.

114203.name: Midgard: Das Fantasy-Rollenspiel (3rd Edition)
rpgissuearticle: Korrekturen zu MIDGARD, Das Fantasy Rollenspiel 3. Ausgabe. Frühjahr 1989
Korrekturen zu MIDGARD, Das Fantasy Rollenspiel 3. Ausgabe. Frühjahr 1989
114203.description:
User Summary:

The core rules of the third edition of Midgard were published as a boxed set. It contained three books:

Das Buch der Abenteuer (The book of adventures)
Das Buch des Schwertes: mit Bestiarium und Tabellenteil (The book of the sword: with bestiary and tables)
Das Buch der Magie: mit Weltbeschreibung (The book of magic: with world description).




It also contained a gamemaster screen, character sheets and 4 dice.

114204.name: Novarium
114204.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Novarium is a troupe-style roleplaying game set in a unique fantasy world called Vaena. The angel Azakriel has visited the humans of this world and given the gift of magic to women, who have in turn reversed the sexism in their society and risen as powerful leaders. This was a last ditch ploy from the heavens to empower the humans to fight against evil, as the demihuman empires had been torn apart through their own greed and hubris.

Gameplay is centered around a magical cooperative that holds magical title to a region, much like a Duke has political rights. Inactive characters can care for the land holding, rest, conduct research, and so on. Meanwhile, the active characters are looking for new sources of magical energy called Essence.

Your party seeks to tame a wild land and bring it under your control. You will face a range of opponents; including other magi, monsters, fae, demons, and devils. As the years go by, you will choose and train apprentices to carry on your mission. Can you drive back the forces of evil and reclaim the land from darkness?

Product Includes:

- Introductory Text for players completely new to RPGs
- Game Rulebook
- Sample World Map
- Sample Continent Maps
- Sample Regional Map
- Character Sheet

114205.name: Chevalier d'Ombre
114205.description:
User summary:

This book (in french) mostly deals with the second part of Zelazny's novels (Merlin's saga). There are also suggestions for creating campaigns and additionnal rules about various aspects, including characters from courts of Chaos, and a short scenario.

This book is shorter than the english book Shadow Knight, but has hard cover and different maquette. The drawings from Florence Magnin and Philippe Barthélémy are very high-quality, compared to the french core rules book or to the english version.

114206.name: Corpse Party Blood Covered
114206.description:
"The game's story is set in Heavenly Host Elementary School (天神小学校 Tenjin Shōgakkō?), an elementary school that was torn down following the murders and disappearances of several of its staff and students. By the start of the series, another school called Kisaragi Academy (如月学園 Kisaragi Gakuen?) has been built over the elementary school site. One night, a group of students from Kisaragi are telling ghost stories about the old school when they are suddenly transported by a mysterious earthquake to another dimension where Heavenly Host Elementary still exists and is haunted by the ghosts of the school's murdered children. The player takes control of the Kisaragi Academy students as they try to find their way home and survive the other mysterious forces that haunt the school."

Choices made during the story can unlock new scenarios or change the games ending.
Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corpse_Party]," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114207.name: Play-Poker
114207.description:
User review: This is to seven-card stud poker as Autobridge is to bridge.

This game simulates playing seven-card stud with six players. Slide one of the game sheets into the game board. Slide the first tab of all the players to see what each player was dealt and how each decided to bet. The player decides what to do without risking real money.

The game cones with fifteen sheets for a total of thirty games.

114208.name: Der Millionencoup
114208.description:
From the back of the book:

"Der Millionencoup

Wer hat Interesse am Tod eines Lokführers?
Als die Detektive auf Wendell Lelands Hilfeersuchen hin in seine Wohnung kommen, hat sein Mörder bereits ganze Arbeit geleistet. Schnell stellt sich bei den Ermittlungen heraus, dass gleich mehrere Personen ein Motiv für diese Tat gehabt hätten. Das Aufspüren des Täters führt die Detektive aber zu weiteren Spuren und in neue Gefahren - bis zu einer bisher unbekannten kriminellen Organisation und deren unglaublichen Plan. Gelingt dieser, könnte das die Grundfesten des gesamten Empires erschüttern!

Der zweite Teil des Buches bietet Quellenmaterial zu folgendem Thema:
Der Hyde Park
Grüne Oase, ein Ort der Erholung und Entspannung, ein Platz, um sich zu treffen, zu kommunizieren und sich der Gesellschaft zu präsentieren - der Hyde Park. Doch diese Wiesen und Bäume und der große See bergen so manche Geheimnisse. Und eines Morgens baumelt eine Leiche am wiedererrichteten Tyburn-Galgen!"

114209.name: Tiefe Wasser
114209.description:
From the back of the book:

"Tiefe Wasser

Auf der Themse beginnt und endet dieser Fall. Doch die Oberfläche des Wassers zeigt nicht, was darunter ist ...

Als der Exilrusse Victor Stassow beim Versuch ertrinkt, seinen in den Fluss gefallenen Sohn zu retten, ist dies offensichtlich ein tragischer Unfall. Auch für Scotland Yard. Hier wie überall konzentriert man sich auf das Ereignis des Jahres: den Besuch des russischen Außenministers. Dessen öffentlicher Empfang durch die Queen bewegt ganz London.
