The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114304.name: Revisiting the Three Kingdoms (Issue 8 - Winter 2003)
114304.description:
Volume II, Issue 8

An adventure for Mordheim: City of the Damned is included

Artwork is credited to Cafe Reo, Creator Workshop, Culturecom Limited, Koei Company, Chenli Publishing Co. and Asiapac Books

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114305.name: Snookered
114305.description:
This game is endorsed by the former world champion John Parrot.
The Game can be played by all ages and you need luck and knowledge.
First of all you set a winning points target or a time limit and then the first player to reach the target or scores the most points is the winner.
To score points you must land on a red block on the Board of which you score as in snooker 1 point, you then spin the dial to see what colour question you must answer (As in snooker you get 2 points for yellow,3 for Green,4 for Brown,5 for Blue,6 for pink and 7 for black) but, depending on the colour,
the questions you must answer get harder).
If you are correct you get another turn if not then it is up to the next player.

John Parrott (1964 - ), pictured on the box. He won the World Snooker Championship in 1991.

114306.name: Sleeping Beauty Game
114306.description:
This is a Parker game, released in 1958 and linked to the animated Disney film.

Each player is the Prince, who must travel along the dangerous paths in order to kiss Sleeping Beauty and awake her from her sleep.
Along the way you must obtain three pictures as without these the Prince must continue along the Deep Sleep path, never reaching Sleeping Beauty.
Magic Wands will help you but Maleficent the evil Fairy will do all she can to stop you and keep Sleeping Beauty forever from awakening.

114307.description:
Zero Point One is a two player abstract strategy game combining elements of Chess and Shogi. The game is inspired by the medieval moves of the Bishop (Alfil) and Queen (Fers) and adds some common medieval unorthodox Chess pieces such as Dabbaba and Wazir along with the orthodox Knight in Western Chess.

Zero Point One is played on a board with sixty four squares arranged in an 8x8 grid.
Each square contains a number from 1 to 8. These numbers have no effect on play but serve as a visual aid so players may easily envision the squares to which certain pieces may have access.

The pieces are named after the co-ordinates by which they move.
Pieces are moved to either a vacant square or to a square occupied by an opposing piece. The opposing piece is thus captured and removed from the board.

With the exception of 0·1 pieces, captured pieces may re-enter the game on the side of the capturing player as in Shogi. In lieu of a regular move, a player may place a captured piece on any vacant square.
The object of the game is to capture the opposing 0·1 piece.
114307.name: 0·1 (Zero Point One)

114309.name: 3-2-1 Dusty Bin Game
114309.description:
"Dusty Bin is in a Spin,He's Really Flipped His Lid.
If You Can Fire Your Counters in,You'll Be the Dusty Kid"
Dusty Bin was a character in the 1980's game show called 3-2-1.
The board has the Dusty Bin character sitting in the middle. Extending from the centre are 4 'hands', one for each player. The game operates with a pull-string mechanism - needs no batteries.

Each player has 10 chips. These are placed one at a time on one of the hands. You then press down on the lever and let go. The chip then flips toward's Dusty. Dusty spins around and the lid opens and closes, so it is not easy to get a chip into the bin.
Try to be the first player to flip all ten chips into the bin!

List of Contents
1 Turntable Unit.
4 Hand Launcher's.
1 Dusty Bin With Lid.
40 Chips in Four Colour's.
1 Set of Rules.

114310.name: Knockspell (Issue 6 - September 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Deadly Distillations and Fantastic Fermentations: Alchemical Ideas
Isles on an Emerald Sea IV
Three Possible Locations of the Cyclopean Dragon's Unplundered Lair
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114310.description:
Sixth Issue.

From the cover:
The Quarterly Resource for Old-School Gaming
Original Edition and Swords & Wizardry
First Edition and OSRIC
All new Adventures, Articles, and Resources

114311.name: Take the Test
114311.description:
"Will You Make a Good Driver?"
"An Educational and Interesting Game For the Whole Family."

Players take a vehicle of their choice.
The Traffic Signal is placed in the centre of the board.
Players move around the board by throwing the dice. They should try to land on the coloured squares and answer questions correctly to gain points. Question subjects include Traffic Problem Pictures, general questions and traffic signs.
The objective is to score 20 Points first and thus win the game.
You must also pay close attention to the signs on the board - If you make a mistake, you lose points.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
3 Packs of Question Cards.
6 Driving Licences.
4 Vehicles.
1 Set of Traffic Lights.
2 Dice.
1 Rules/Questions/Answers Booklet.

114312.name: Anima Tactics: Elhaim, Maiden of Light
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114312.description:
The Elhaim, or Maidens of Light, are luminous powers born of pure light before the war in heaven. Many believe them to be angels, whose powers will be essential to saving Gaia from the dark.

Light Summon Warrior/Mystic
Level 40 version
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 15 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Light
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 8 | Shock: -1
Innate Abilities: Flight, Immunity (Poison).
Defensive Mastery: Performing Basic Counterattacks costs Elhaim two action points instead of three.
o - Light Flash (Magic, Effect) All enemy Units in base-to-base contact with Elhaim suffer Blind lv.1. Effect 15.
Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Healing Light (Magic, Effect) A friendly Unit inside Elhaim's Control Zone gains Healing Lv.2.
ooo - Wings of Withdrawal (Ki, Attack) +2 Attack / +2 Damage. If this attack hits, Elhaim may automatically escape
from any hand-to-hand combat she is engaged in and move up to 8 Inches. Elhaim can use this movement even if
she has already moved this turn.
o - Light Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) Distance (8 Inches). This attack can only be used immediately after successfully
escaping from combat due to the Wings of Withdrawal skill.

Level 50 version
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP: 15 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Light
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 8 | Shock: -3
Innate Abilities: Flight, Immunity (Poison).
Defensive Mastery: Performing Basic Counterattacks costs Elhaim two action points instead of three.
o - Light Flash (Magic, Effect) All enemy Units in base-to-base contact with Elhaim suffer Blind lv.1. Effect 15.
Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Healing Light (Magic, Effect) A friendly Unit inside Elhaim's Control Zone gains Healing Lv.2.
ooo - Wings of Withdrawal (Ki, Attack) +2 Attack / +2 Damage. If this attack hits, Elhaim may automatically escape
from any hand-to-hand combat she is engaged in and move up to 8 Inches. Elhaim can use this movement even if
she has already moved this turn.
o - Light Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) Distance (8 Inches). This attack can only be used immediately after successfully
escaping from combat due to the Wings of Withdrawal skill.
ooo - Catastrophic Light (Magic, Ranged Attack) Distance (16 Inch). +2 Damage. If this attack hits its target, all Units
within 3 inches of the target also suffer the attack.

114313.name: Madame Tussaud's
114313.description:
A trip to Madame Tussauds - without leaving your living room.
The aim of the Game is to tour the Musuem trying to match up your six celebrities that you are given, The Celebrities are all on their Plinths awaiting your visit but, frustratingly, they are constantly changing their plinth - either by someone getting thier first or your competitors changing them around.
There are also Jack the Ripper cards which can not be matched in the Musuem so you must try and swap these cards with your fellow players to stop them winning.

Celebrities on the box include Luciano Pavarotti, Benny Hill, Henry VIII and Michael Jackson.

114314.name: Desert Island Discs
114314.description:
This game is based on the famous BBC radio show (the longest running radio show in the world and still on today), where guest are invited to choose 8 pieces of music they would like to have if they were stranded on a desert island.

The objective is to reach the centre of the island and identify who is on the desert island.

Like lots of trivia games, the space (here it is an area of the island) you are on dictates which category you must answer a question on that turn.

114315.name: Supremo
114315.description:
Monopoly-style game in which playing pieces move around a track and purchase business and pay when landing on a business owned by another player.
Includes bonuses for getting several like coloured properties, mortgages and event cards.
What may make this of interest is that all the businesses are real business in the Birmingham (England) area, and they have all clearly paid to have their adverts put on the board!

114316.description:
A card game of stealth and sneakiness! Players act as spymasters, collecting sets of cards in order to complete missions. Only the greatest player will be declared The Ace Of Spies! By taking two cards at the start of each turn, you'll build up a selection of Agents, Tools, Intelligence and Locations that will allow you to hopefully finish more missions than everyone else. More missions mean more points - as long as they're complete! If they're left incomplete by the end of the game, they score negative points and pretty much ensure you're not going to win...

Four separate decks are needed to play the game. The Mission Deck cards state what combinations are needed in order to complete a mission. The more specific the requirements the more points the completed mission is worth - some can be very difficult to finish but will prove very lucrative, but there's always the risk they'll count against you.

The other decks represent three different cities - London, Paris and Berlin - and contain the Agents, Tools, Intelligence and Locations you'll need. Intervention cards can be used as instants and will allow you to turn the game in your favour (as long as you play them at the correct time. Should that all important card you require be lost in the discard piles, you may be able to retrieve it, but that'll come at a high cost.

Between two and five spymasters can attempt to become the Ace of Spies! May the most devious and sneaky win!
114316.name: Ace of Spies
boardgamepodcastepisode: Funding the Dream on Kickstarter Ep 62 Ace of Spies and the London Whisperer
House Rules 36: Interview with Michael Fox, Co-Designer of Aces of Spies
The One About Spies Like Us

114317.name: Pocket Universe
114317.description:
Welcome to the future! At the dawn of the 25th Century, races from across the void have worked together to develop incredible technologies. Humans, Borganoids, Ursans and Gryzz have lived in harmony for decades... until now. Following the invention of a brand new device called PUGS, tensions have grown.

PUGS, the Pocket Universe Generation System, is an amazing invention. When fired up, a brand new self-contained universe is created, filled with precious elements ready to be plundered – as long as the players can find them. They'll need to race around the Pocket Universe and grab what they can as quickly as possible, avoiding attacks from the opposition

Players fly about the Pocket Universe made up of hexes, controlling their starship and attempting to explore planets and mine four different types of resources. Once collected they can either choose to return them to their starbase in order to score points or keep some aboard in order to use them to perform special abilities - some aggressive, some defensive.

Once a set amount of planets have been discovered, players must then make a final race to return their remaining resources to their base and score that last points boost. Whoever has the most points at the end will be declared the winner! Will you come out on top?

114318.name: Password!
114318.description:
The objective of the game is to score points by correctly guessing the Password from your team mate's clues.

The players split into two teams and a word is given to one team member who must give clues to enable their team mates to correctly identify the word, This is all done against an electronic varying timer so you must think and talk quickly to find the word before the timer runs out. Some words are easy but some are very difficult to describe in a short space of time.

Pre-establish a time before play starts and the team with the most points when that time is reached, wins

114319.name: DIRGE Dark Modern Fantasy RPG
rpg: Dirge Dark Modern Fantasy Roleplaying Game
114319.description:
From the Back of the Book:

In the hidden world called the Tenebrae, Unnatural beings struggle for survival and power. Mystics search for enlightenment and grapple with madness. Ghuls hunt mortals to consume their flesh. And in the strange worlds of the Pleroma, the Children of Light have lost their ancient war and Fallen to Earth. Can anyone protect the Many Realms from the Elder Beasts? Or is this the sounding of the final Dirge?

114320.name: Fuchsjagd am Kahleberg
114320.description:
Objective: be the first catching the fox before fox has finished
the circuit
- moving by turn/'Roll & Move' game -
each player starts from the alpine hut, fox (red meeple) with 5-10 spaces ahead; fox must reach top of the mountain (Kahleberg) and return successfully to alpine hut;
players should arrange themselves which route is followed by whom;
fox can't run past a hunter (but turn) and is caught if hunter's roll ends on the same space

114321.name: 100 Character Personality Archetypes
114321.description:
From the Introduction:

Have a sudden need for a basic NPC personality, but have no ideas? These are a few classic personality archetypes. You can roll a couple of times to get more depth, or even use the archetypes as a backstory to explore the NPC's history, and how they came to be who they are today. For more complex characters, roll multiple times, and explore how the character got to be that way. Give it a try!

rpg: Dirge Dark Modern Fantasy Roleplaying Game
114322.name: Dirge: Hellfire & Asphalt
114322.description:
From the Introduction:

The DIRGE RPG covers a lot of ground, but some things got left out in the effort to cover the basics. Your Pact may get into a car chase, or may encounter a wide variety of medieval or high-tech weapons out in the Pleroma. You may wish to play as one of the vicious, territorial, shapeshifting Enkidu, or one of the wretched Children of Darkness, or a member of one of the many minor Mystic Cult. You may just want more information on the conspiracies of the Hierates, looking for some faint glimmer of hope, some weakness in their monolithic structure. Except for that last bit, hope, you can find all of that here.

114323.name: inMomentum
114323.description:
InMomentum is a minimalistic sci-fi platform racing game that challenges the players to think in both horizontal and vertical perspectives while racing against each other or against the clock in a puzzle-like environment.

InMomentum gives the players the possibility to explore a visually unique world by having minimized object detail and a special focus on visual stimulation by the use of colors and shapes. The game’s style forges a strong bond between the visuals and the player, thus provides a very unique experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

rpg: Invulnerable Tabletop Super Hero Roleplaying Game
114324.name: Dauntless
114324.description:
From the Introduction:

True heroes cannot be stopped. Nothing will stop a true hero from reaching their goal. Maybe you can hurt them; but their fighting spirit, their indefatigable determination, makes them invulnerable. They do not give into fear or despair, their inner demons, or the whisperings of others. Their devotion to justice, freedom, protection of the weak carries them through any ordeal.

True heroes are dauntless.

The Dauntless sourcebook is a companion to the Invulnerable RPG, like a sidekick. A smaller, scrappier brand of adventuresome goodness, to enhance and banter with the bigger, beefier core rulebook. Sure, the core rulebook is all you need, but sometimes, with another hero, you've got a one-two punch that finishes off the villain and saves the day.

114325.name: Tales of Glory and Terror Fantasy Roleplaying Game
rpg: Tales of Glory and Terror Fantasy Roleplaying Game
114325.description:
From the Introduction:

The Tales of Glory and Terror Fantasy Roleplaying Game is a cooperative, interactive game designed to let you and your friends have fun creating a story about adventurers exploring a fantasy world. The world of Kaellith is a traditional fantasy world, with Elves, Dwarves, sorcerers, gods, magic, and vile creatures, all waiting to be described in your story.

114327.name: Fungibility
114327.description:
Fungibility is a strategic, Euro-style, economic engine, resource management card game for 2-4 players, which uses 108 cards, and no other components.

Fungibility is also a financial term, referring to commodities which are functionally indistinguishable from one another, such as currency, graded crude oil, and pure gold. In keeping with this concept, the cards in Fungibility (the card game) are all identical copies of the same card.

To create some degree of randomness, the deck is shuffled, first with half the cards rotated, then a second time with half the cards flipped face-up. The facing, position, and even rotational orientation of cards relative to each player's seating position has a logically distinct meaning within the game, meaning that the same card in the supply may have completely different meanings to each player.

The basic game is free to print and play. It is the author's intent that, should the game be published and sold at retail, the retail cards would include art elements unreferenced by the core rules. As of writing, the author has three expansions designed, each of which would merely describe rules for the unreferenced art elements, and which would be made available free of charge, post release.

114328.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 2 - Jan 2003)
rpgissuearticle: d20 Submission: The Dragon Shield of Syoss
Sneak Peek: The Book of Hallowed Might
114328.description:
Cover by Christopher Martinez (II)

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114329.description:
Cover by Eric Lofgren

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114330.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 4 - Mar 2003)
114330.description:
Special Western Issue

Cover by Jon Hodgson

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114331.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 5 - Apr 2003)
114331.description:
Cover by Jeremy McHugh

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114332.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 6 - May 2003)
rpgissuearticle: GameWyrd Review: Visira: Dangerous Dungeons: Goblins' Lair
114332.description:
May-June 2003

Cover image provided by Flying Mice LLC

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114333.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 7 - Jul 2003)
114333.description:
Cover by V. Shane Colclough

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114334.name: Dispatches from the Bunker #33
114334.description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader. This issue has an analysis of ‘Raid on Rodimstev’, Tactical Tips and perspectives on four scenarios. Also included are four scenarios:

DB090 Bedouin Blitz - A mixed force of British infantry and armored cars must hold off determined Iraqi Nationalists during the 1941 independence movement.

DB091 Atrocities Beget Atrocities - Japanese and Chinese infantry tangle in a city battle during the 1928 during the Jinan Incident.

DB092 The Streets of Kharkov - The Soviet 3rd Tank Army and the SS Leibstandarte clash during the Third Battle of Kharkov.

DB093 Thunder from Heaven - American glider troops land in the midst of a German infantry division during Operation Varsity.

114335.name: Daniel X: The Ultimate Power
114335.description:
Box Description:

The ultimate power is the power to create!

Daniel X was born with the greatest power of all, the power to create. Now, the fate of the world rests on his shoulders - saving the world has never been easy, but it's a fight Daniel is made for.

As an alien, I've developed some amazing powers; strength, speed, transformation, but the most incredible power of all: the power of creation.

-Create: Conquer aliens from "The List" by changing into an eagle and soar your way to victory.

-Explore: Solve intriguing puzzles and discover new ares within the alien universe while battling your way back to Earth.

-Fight: Battle a myriad of relentless enemies using wits, strength and speed.

Nintendo DSi Feature: Aliens are everywhere - Use your Nintendo DSi camera to determine who you can trust.

114336.name: Im Reich der Phantasie
114336.description:
User Summary:

Im Reich der Phantasie was a sized down version of the Midgard core rules designed for beginners and newcomers to the Midgard world. It contained two books, Buch der Regeln (Book of Rules) and Buch der Abenteuer (Book of Adventures).
The Book of Adventures contained three adventures:

Unter den Nebelbergen (Under the Misty Mountains)
Über den Perellion-Paß (Over the Perellion Pass)
Die Insel des Widdergottes (The Island of the God Ram)




The rules of this boxed set included only four basic character classes, the warrior, the adventurer, the priest and the mage up to level 5.

114337.name: Rayman: Raving Rabbids TV Party (DS)
videogamehonor: 2009 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
114337.description:
Box Description:

The Rabbids have invaded your TV in the wackiest game ever!

-Challenge friends in multiplayer mini-games

-Customize your Rabbids in hysterical ways!

-More than 40 hilarious mini-games!

114338.name: Hexenzauber & Druidenkraft
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114338.description:
User Summary:

Hexenzauber & Druidenkraft is a guide to magic in the world of Midgard. It brought about 100 new spells and lots of additional information about the magic wielding classes of Midgard.

A lot of material from this sourcebook found its way into the 4th edition of Midgard, except those spells that were considered unbalanced.

114339.name: Ghost Pirates: Promotional Captain Cards
114339.description:
This is a set of extra Captain Cards for the Ghost Pirates card game that can be added to the card deck and played like any standard Captain card during the course of the game.

Captain Keeshan - Immune to being hit directly by cannon fire.

Captain Sharkey - When Rum sends opponent's crew overboard, one is eaten by a shark and returns below decks.

Captain Sea Swindler - May discard one card to switch the direction of a an Ocean Current card.

Captain Jack - Draw 3 cards instead of two when using Rum to draw cards.

Captain Strongarms - Rolls 3 dice instead of two in a fight

Captain Sid - If any hits are scored by his side in a battle he is participating in, score one additional hit.

114340.name: Ghost Pirates: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
boardgameversion: Brooklyn Indie Games Kickstarter Exclusive Edition
114340.description:
This is a set of additional promotional cards for Ghost Pirates that was made available exclusively to those who supported the Kickstarter project at a certain level.

The Sea Wolf (captain) - When your captain would be forced to walk the plank, return him to the poop deck under control of your opponent (treat as an additional mate who returns to opponent’s Poop Deck, not your own). Your Mate now runs the ship, and must behave as the captain if he is on your ship (or once he returns to your ship).

Rats (treasure) - Play on a cargo hold. This cargo hold enters play with 0 crew and may not be replaced. Any fights taking place here score one additional automatic hit per side.

East India Trading Co. Representative (captain) - On your turn, when EITC rep is in a fight, kill one opposing crew before normal fight dice are rolled.

114341.name: Im Land des Mondjaguars
114341.description:
User Summary:

Im Land des Mondjaguars (In the Land of the Moon Jaguar) is the sourcebook for the island continent of Nahuatlan. The setting is inspired by the Aztec, Maya and Inca cultures of south and central America.
Included in the book is a coloured map of Nahuatlan.

114342.name: Come on Down!!
114342.description:
From the back of the book

Come on Down!

This is the first full-length adventure for use with the second edition of the DC Heroes Role-Playing Game. It can be played by four to six Players and includes:


Statistics for Justice League Europe, Manga Khan, L-Ron, Catherine Cobert and the Forgotten Villains
A fun-filled game show featuring 10 outrageous events
Detailed maps
And much, much more!

114343.name: Song of the Beast-Gods (Pathfinder)
114343.description:
From the rear cover:

The land of Yar-Ammon is old -- and even older are its gods. In the desert city of Khadis, a colossal faceless sphinx broods over empty altars and forbidden secrets. Hungry beasts gather ever closer to the city gates, while strange plots are afoot in the royal palace. Legacies from the past haunt an old king, and the sinister priests of Zothur watch from the shadows of the throne.

Can you unravel the mysteries of accursed Khadis -- and live to tell the tale?

Written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, the adventure in this book can be easily adapted to any fantasy roleplaying game ruleset or edition.

Book features:

A fully detailed sword and sorcery adventure for character levels 2-3
Use as a stand-alone module for an evening or two of play, or use the background information as the basis for several adventures
A mix of wilderness travel, palace intrigue, and delving into forbidden underground vaults -- a chance for every character class to shine!
Region, city and dungeon maps
New monsters and creature templates
Background information on the lands, races and cults of the World of Xoth

114344.name: Im Bann der Todesechsen
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114344.description:
User Summary:

Im Bann der Todesechsen is the sourcebook for the subcontinent Rawindra, an indian oriental setting.
In this setting the inhabitants of Rawindra, called Rawindi, have been fighting against a folk of lizard men called Sritras for generations.

114345.name: Stonehell Dungeon: Down Night-Haunted Halls
114345.description:
From the rear cover:

Beware All Who Enter
These Benighted Halls of Stone.
Within Lies No Solace
Nor Any Comforts of Home.
Toiling For Our Crimes
We Must Dig Where We Dwell,
With No Freedom or Mercy
In Our Vast Stony Hell.

-Inscription over the entrance of Stonehell Dungeon

Stonehell Dungeon is a classic-style megadungeon, filled with enough monsters, traps, weirdness, and treasure to keep you gaming for a long, long time. Explore over 700 rooms, encounter more than 40 new monsters, and discover 18 mysterious magical items -- and that's just in the first book!

Stonehell Dungeon: Down Night-Haunted Halls details the first six levels of a megadungeon intended for use with the Labyrinth Lord™ role-playing game, but is easily adaptable to most early versions of the original fantasy role-playing game and its retro-clones. Stonehell Dungeon gives the game master all the necessary information to run his players through the dungeon, while offering enormous opportunities to customize and expand on the site.

The monsters of Stonehell Dungeon are waiting to meet you. Won't you come in?

114346.name: The Pearl of Pirates' Cove
114346.description:
From the publishers page:

The abandoned caves at Pirate's Cove have been avoided for years. But strange sightings of phantom shapes along the cliffs have caused concern for the local village folk.(For beginning characters of 1st or 2nd level; used with Holmes/Holmes77 or '81 rules.

114347.name: Marvel Slingers
114347.description:
Marvel Slingers combines collectibles with toys in this dexterity game. The Marvel Universe provides the setting as heroes and villains (such as Hades, Loki and Athena) battle each other for supremacy at your hands.

The basic game consists of several elements. You have a battle map, a set of battle medallions, power boost medallions, and the central element - your Slinger. The Slinger is a ball-shaped yo-yo-like creation with a magnet on the under-belly; each Slinger has its own personality in terms of power and stamina, making different ones suitable for different levels of expertise.

You use the Slinger to attack your opponents' battle medallions on the battle map, wielding the Slinger like a yo-yo. Your aim is to make contact with your chosen target and defeat it. The built-in power meter measures power, and a winner is determined. Each round is played as a 5-on-5 battle.

The collectible aspect comes in the form of different Slingers and different medallions (both battle and power boost) – all in various levels of rarity.

114348.name: Man Eater
114348.description:
From the rear cover:

A naive slave girl is banished to the wastelands after tempting her master - the Grand Shiek! Dying, she calls upon the powers of the Dark ro help her. But what came in answer to her plea had its own reasons.

Having no other choice, she gave in - again. And she has suffered for doing so every since!

114349.name: Barbarenwut & Ritterehre
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
114349.description:
User Summary:

Barbarenwut & Ritterehre (Barbarian Fury & Knights Honor) is the third sourcebook published under the Gildenbrief label. It contained additional information and rules for the fighting classes of Midgard:

Assassin
Barbarian
Adventurer
Warrior
Ranger




It also included information about castles and and weapons.

114350.name: Super-Giants!
114350.description:
From the publishers page:

This is a complete compilation of all 6 giant modules in this series (G4-9) It does not include the "Anniversary Edition" of the G4, but a previous one. For high level 1E characters. Includes a new, additional, adventure (G9+)

114351.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Elrond, the Elf Lord of Rivendell, is troubled by the great numbers of Orcs that plagued the heroes who escorted his daughter, Arwen Undómiel, across the Misty Mountains. He asks them to explore the mines of Moria, hoping they can determine if they are the source of the increased Orc activity, but before the heroes can explore Moria's vast network of tunnels, they must first gain entrance...

The Watcher in the Water is the third Adventure Pack in the "Dwarrowdelf" cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. Once they pass the Doors of Durin, the heroes of Middle-earth must explore the mines of Moria to find the cause of the increased Orc activity in the Misty Mountains. Yet they must first survive the perils of the fetid Swamps and the ferocious combat with the Watcher's many Tentacles.

Note: A copy of The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game Core Set and the Khazad-dûm Expansion are required to play the scenario included in this Adventure Pack.
114351.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Watcher in the Water
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Watcher in the Water
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

114352.name: Smuggler's Bane
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114352.description:
From the front cover:

Ronin Arts steps back in time to an age of excessive violence, deep dungeons, wandering monsters, and late-night gaming excitement! SMUGGLER’S BANE, the latest release in Ronin Art’s FIRST EDITION FANTASY series, features a journey through sea-side caverns and an encounter with an evil race of fish-like monsters. For 4-6 characters levels 5-7. For use with OSRIC or any other first edition-style game system.

This product uses the OSRIC System (Oldschool System Reference and Index Compilation). The OSRIC system text may be found at http://www.knights-n-knaves.com/osric.

114354.name: Shadowbrook Manor
114354.description:
From the front cover:

Once a powerful proponent of Law, the Archmage Tazimack the Red was eventually driven mad by a fear of mortality. As he slipped into insanity his retirement home began to reflect the chaotic bent of his mind. Long after Tazimack’s unnaturally animated body has disintegrated, his manor house remains as a shadow cast by a twisted intellect. Can the characters bring order to this chaos?

114355.name: The Ruins of Tenkuhran
114355.description:
From the publishers page:

Deep in a sweltry jungle lies a malignant force waiting to be rediscovered...again! Designed for OS early rules editions (adaptable to most) for characters levels 6-10

114356.name: The Ruined Hamlet / Terror in the Gloaming
114356.description:
From the front cover:

Into the Unknown! The wilderness around the cave stronghold called Gold Hill Trading Post is dangerous and scattered with ruins of large and small settlements. Will your party find fame and fortune, solve ancient mysteries, or just disappear into the Borderlands like so many that came before?

This module contains underground and wilderness maps that form a detailed adventure and mini-campaign for beginning characters, including an abandoned village, haunted graveyard, ruined church, traders’ camp, wilderness encounters, and monster lairs. It also includes a ruined keep and dungeon as well as a mapped and detailed “base camp” stronghold. The module is designed for use with all “classic” fantasy roleplaying game rulebooks or sets for Basic- and Expert-level players and gamemasters. It can be converted for use with “Advanced” fantasy game rules and compatible systems with a minimum of effort.

114357.name: Voyage to Plague Island
114357.description:
From the rear cover:

Captured!

While sojourning in a nameless village on the Parched Coast you must have been slipped sleeping powders. You awoke on board an oared galley in chains, and forced to row. Your mind numb and unable to recall much, you rowed for what seemed like days. Talk among the other slaves was that the ship was bound for Plague Island. Your cruel captors, when not whipping you and your oar mates told you how wealthy you would make them once they sold you, and of how well you would die in the arena at the Jade Palace.

Through a haze of drugs and pain, you were able to recall bits of legend of such a place. On the coast and in distant lands, the island is spoken of in hushed tones in the back rooms of bars, in thieves' and wizards' guilds and among restless and bloodthirsty delvers and adventurers. It is said that a group of very wealthy and powerful people use the island as a sort of playground, where gladiatorial combats are held, where powerful mages meet to trade dark secrets, and where the hunting of human prey is carried out in the jungle.

114358.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 8 - Aug 2003)
rpgissuearticle: An Interview with... J. Phillip Reed
Nuts & Bolts of the Action! System
114358.description:
Cover by Christopher Martinez (II)

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114359.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 9 - Sep 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Bluffside: City on the Edge - Points of Interest
Nuts & Bolts of Active Exploits Diceless
114359.description:
Listed on the cover as September 2003; most online sources have this listed as the October issue. PDF date is 2003-09-30.

Cover by V. Shane Colclough

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114360.name: Turbo Tops
114360.description: The goal of Turbo Tops is to be the last top standing (still spinning). Each player (2-4) powers their top by blowing through a flexi-straw, then pulling them all out in unison. The tops spin and collide on the concave board, whichever one lasts the longest is the winner.

114361.description:
Span is a two-player connection game for the Shibumi set.

The board is initially empty. White owns the top and bottom sides, and Black owns the left and right sides.

Players take turns adding a piece of their colour until the board is full.

The game is won by the player with a visibly connected path of their pieces between their sides.

Span is an entry in the Shibumi Challenge.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
114361.name: Span

114362.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 10 - Nov 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Feature Review: Invasion of Monster Island
114362.description:
Cover by Christopher Martinez (II)

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114364.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 11 - Dec 2003)
114364.description:
Cover by William McAusland

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114365.name: RPGNow Downloader Monthly (Issue 12 - Jan 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Cast of Thousands Excerpt: Azag Boneseer
Novice to Master Excerpt: Malkan Knight
114365.description:
Cover by William McAusland

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114366.name: 1862: Shiloh
114366.description:
"1862 - Shiloh (American Civil War in 3D)
Shiloh is the tenth battle in the series, this TWO day battle sees the Confederates launch a surprise attack against the Union who are in encampment. This battle is finely balanced and could go either way once the Union reserves arrive for the second day.
The game comes with a printable game board that can be constructed 3 dimensionally for an impressive realistic feel. Counters, rules and all playing aids accompany the game including a set of tile dice for those of you without any cube dice." - www.wargameshop.co.uk
This game, as well as any other in the series, is an easy pleasure to play. Combat units (brigades, batteries) show range, attack (to hit die roll), and strength. Leaders show organization level and command area. If subordinate units aren't close enough to the leader, there is only a chance they will be able to fire or move. Victory is achieved by controlling certain hexes and disabling or dispersing the opponents' units. Low counter numbers (32 confederate, 49 union) don't overwhelm the nicely drawn map. If someone wishes to make the effort, the maps can be created in 3D.

114368.name: Defense Grid: The Awakening: You Monster
114368.description:
User Summary

This expansion combines Portal narrator GLaDOS with the avuncular Entity narrator from previous Defense Grid games. The 8 new maps resemble the Aperture Science facilities but are structurally the same as previous Defense Grid maps, allowing construction of the same towers.

The plot for this series opens with the Entity happily welcoming GLaDOS as an aid against the aliens, before he is overwhelmed by her on the first map and only occasionally able to advise or help the player. This affects gameplay as GLaDOS revels in not only insulting and misleading the player with Portalesque comments, but in taking away towers, not allowing certain (or any!) towers to be built, or increasing the alien presence beyond what it possible to defend.

114369.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 1 - Sep 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Good Vs. Evil - The Open Gaming License
114369.description:
Volume 1 / Issue 1

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114370.name: DinoBump
114370.description:
Playing Pieces: 1 Board, 6 Dinosaurs, and 1 Die

Begin The Game

Who Goes First: The youngest player goes first. After the 1st game, the winner of the previous game goes first. Play proceeds clockwise.

Begin the Game: Place all dinosaurs in the Dino-Bath. Roll 1 die and go forward the spaces indicated on the die, then follow instructions on each of the rocks. There is only 1 die used in this game.

Only one dinosaur can occupy any space on board at one time. The only place that more than one dinosaur is allowed to occupy, is the Dino-Bath.

Dino-Bump: When you land on a space that is already occupied by another dinosaur, that dinosaur goes back to the Dino-Bath and your dinosaur stays on that space. This move is called a Dino-Bump.

On a Safe rock, however, you are safe from a Dino-Bump. See additional rules for Safe rock.

How to Win

The first player to enter the Dino Cave is the winner! You can only enter the Dino Cave with an exact roll of the die. If you roll a number that is greater than the number needed to enter the Dino Cave, do not move forward. Wait until your next turn and try again to enter.

The rule is different, however, for the last Dino Jump rock. From here, if you roll a 1, then you enter the Dino Cave. If you don’t roll a 1, then go back number on die. See additional rules for Dino Jump rock and Last Dino Jump rock.

114371.name: The Witness (2016)
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best International Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Open World Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Gaming Moment Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Visual Design of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Honorable Mention
114371.description:
"Thus shall you think of this fleeting world:
A star at dawn, a bubble in a stream,
A flash of lightning in a summer cloud,
A flickering lamp, a phantom, and a dream"

The Witness is a puzzle adventure game, experienced in the first-person view. The player, as an unnamed character, finds himself on an island with numerous structures and natural formation. The island is divided into ten sections arranged around a mountain that represents the ultimate goal for the player. Within each section, the player will encounter numerous puzzles, and once the player has completed all puzzles in a section, a gold turret will emerge from around that section and shine a light towards the mountain. The player needs to complete seven of the ten section sections to be able to access the puzzles within the mountain and complete the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Witness_%282013_video_game...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114372.name: Lollipop Chainsaw
114372.description:
Available in 2012, Lollipop Chainsaw is the‘un-deadly’ story of sweet but killer zombie-hunter Juliet Starling and her quest to uncover the root of a colossal zombie outbreak. With her wickedly awesome chainsaw in hand, Juliet slices, dices and splits her way through hordes of the undead, but soon realizes the horde is only the opening act to a festival of zombie rock lords determined to kill the chainsaw-wielding cheerleader.

Source: The Developer Website.

114373.name: Watchtower on the Hill
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114373.description:
From the rear cover:

The door to the Mughouse bursts open as a man yells "Help, someone, anyone!" The pub quiets into whispers and frightened stares. The man is an overweight laborer in a blue grey tunic and flowing brown hair and beard. He is sweating excissively and looks very winded. A boy runs in behind him and stands to his side, helping the man stay on his feet. It takes the laborer a moment to catch his breathe before wheezing out, "please someone, my boy Kevin has fallen down a hole at the old watchtower! I cannot get to him. I need able-bodied folk to get my boy out safe!"

Another bar patron yells forth "the old watchtower? What do ye mean Donald? Many people have been up to the tower, kids play in it, it has no holes or anything?"

Donald replies, " I know, but Gregory here came to get me when Kevin fell in and took me up to where the hole is. There is a hole and ladder under the dirt and boards of the main floor of the tower. I don't know why it's never been found before, but the hole sure is there and my boy is down in it, so who's gonna help me?"

The old watchtower stands outside of town. The boy's frantic father requests your aid. Are you brave enough to delve deep down inside the watchtower on the hill?

114374.name: Warrens of the Great Goblin Chief
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114374.description:
From the rear cover:

Goblins have returned to the area of Westgate, seeking an ancient magical item constructed for their foul kind. In their search, the goblins attack an imperial convoy secretly disguised as a merchant’s wagon. The knowledge that goblins are near must be kept quiet from the public, thus a small band of adventurers is required to seek out the creatures and the stolen magic item, deep inside the warrens of the great goblin chief!

But the adventure does not end there...

114375.name: Ghosts from the Dark Wood
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114375.description:
From the rear cover:

Wesselrum is a small hamlet of free farmers located deep in the northern pine forests. The secretive hamlet folk fear and repel outsiders but now seek out a band of heroes to help them end the suffering of their children who are succumbing to a terrible wasting sickness caused by a frightening forest ghost. The heroes will find themselves wrapped within a web of misinformation, half-truths, and outright lies as they attempt to save the children of Wesselrum from an unexpected foe.

114376.name: Of Hunger and Lies
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114376.description:
From the rear cover:

A creature stalks the streets of Westgate Town, feasting on the humble lower class citizens. The locals believe the monster to be a werewolf and hire both a famed werewolf hunter and a party of adventurers to seek out and defeat the beast before it strikes again!

But, things take a turn... Can you solve the grisly mystery and save the folk of Westgate Town or will the killer continue to subsist on hunger and lies?

114377.name: Usherwood Adventures Introductory Adventure Bundle
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
114377.description:
From the publisher's website:

Includes four complete adventures, designed for First Edition and OSRIC fantasy-based roleplaying game systems.

Contains the adventures:
The Bone-Hilt Sword Campaign Book 1: Yrchyn, the Tyrant
The Rebel Faction
Arachnophobia!
The Door of Infinite Portals

114379.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 2 - Oct 2002)
114379.description:
Volume 1 / Issue 2

Halloween Double Size Issue

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

114380.description:
Revenge of the Raven Consort is the 3rd game in the Lassadar Trilogy (Shadows Upon Lassadar and Sorrow of Salilth are the other 2).

This is a solitaire 'Choose Your Own Adventure' style card game lasting about 20 minutes

Needed to play:
• the 81 cards split into five separate game decks (Quest, Event, Combat, Spell and Win/Loss) each with their own icon and color
• 2d10 - used for combat and d100 percentage rolls (it is suggested that each d10 is a different color)
• 36 wooden cubes (used to mark spells (17), books (8), spirit/mana/fate (3) and combat strength (4) and special bonuses (4) some Event cards give you)

Play:
You are trying to find 9 lost books before the Raven Consort and the servants of the Grayking do. Cards are drawn from one of 5 decks (Quest, Combat, Spell, Event and Win/Loss), with each deck forming the basis of the choices you make in the game.

Each of the Quest, Spell and Event cards has a title at the top, text in the middle which must be resolved first, and a series of icons at the bottom.

Once you resolve the text in the middle, you can choose one of the bottom listed actions and draw your next card from that corresponding color deck, discarding the current ‘in play’ card.

Game end:
The game ends in one of 2 ways:
1. Once 9 books have been recovered by you and/or by the Raven
Consort, the game ends. If you have found the majority of the books you win the game, thwart the Raven Consort and save Lassadar. If the Raven Consort has the majority of the books, she wins and Lassadar is plunged back into misery and darkness.
2. If your spirit falls below 1 on the spirit track you have lost the game and become one of the Raven Consort’s Thralls and you are forever damned.
114380.name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Revenge of the Raven Consort

114381.name: Shift 2: Unleashed
114381.description:
Shift 2: Unleashed (also known as Need for Speed: Shift 2 Unleashed) is a racing video game, the 17th title in the Need for Speed franchise. It was developed by Slightly Mad Studios and published by Electronic Arts. Shift 2: Unleashed was released worldwide during March and April 2011, although it has yet to be released in Japan.

Shift 2: Unleashed is the direct sequel to the 2009 video game Need for Speed: Shift and expands on the gameplay and features introduced with the original. Shift 2: Unleashed features over 145 cars from more than 37 manufacturers and over 36 different tracks, which players can compete in several types of races. Players can also compete online. The game also features three new main additions: an in-helmet camera, night-time racing and the Autolog feature introduced with Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit.

Shift 2 features more than 140 licensed vehicles available for racing and tuning, a smaller number compared with racing sims such as Forza Motorsport 3 and Gran Turismo 5. However, executive producer Marcus Nilsson said the studio wanted to concentrate on having only the must-have speedsters. Exclusively digitized for the game is the Pagani Huayra. There are also 40 real-world locations including Bathurst, Spa-Francorchamps and Suzuka as well as fictional circuits like downtown London and Shanghai.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shift 2: Unleashed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114382.name: Faces of Thedas: Tallis
114382.description:
From the introduction:

The deadly and witty elf assassin called Tallis is an exciting new addition to the world of Dragon Age, debuting simultaneously in the original web series, Dragon Age: Redemption, written by and starring Felicia Day, and the Dragon Age II downloadable content, Mark of the Assassin. Felicia Day created the character of Tallis and portrays her in both projects. Now, with this short DLC for the Dragon Age tabletop roleplaying game , GMs can import this intriguing character into their own campaigns.

Is Tallis an ally or a rival? Is she out to aid or thwart your campaign’s PCs? Does she spark a new adventure or add complexity to one already underway? In the dynamic stories of the Dragon Age RPG, anything’s possible.

The following pages give you background lore and game statistics for Tallis so you can use her in your campaign. We also present a short interview with Felicia Day, spotlighting her creation and portrayal of Tallis, so you can get a clearer idea of how to play the part in your own RPG adventures. What’s here builds
on, but does not spoil, the various projects in which Tallis appears. For more information, enjoy Mark of the Assassin and Redemption.

114383.name: Utara
114383.description:
Utara is a dice game that makes a game board from any surface on earth. The game's theme calls to mind constellations and stellar navigation.

Utara makes use of several dice that in each face says either North, East, South, or West. The fifth face has a Sun and the sixth face is Moon. You can use any number of dice to play, with a minimum of ten dice per player. More dice will allow higher scores, possibly longer games and require more space to play.

Give the playing surface directions, meaning north, south, east and west. Players roll their dice on the playing surface at the same time. Pick one player to start randomly. The player chooses a die with a cardinal direction in it, and moves it in the direction of its face up. When meeting another dice, collect it and change directions to match the new dice face. Continue in this manner until you go out of bounds. Then the next player does the same thing and so on.

The game ends when no more North, East, South or West dice remain. Each player scores one point for every die in their collection.

It is best to play a few rounds of Utara, once for each participating player. The player who had the fewest points in the previous round should take the first turn in the next round, so they have an opportunity to catch up. Points are tallied over a series of rounds to determine the winner.

114384.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 5 - Sep 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Miniature Review - Wizards of the Coast
114384.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

114385.name: Dice Bowl Football
114385.description:
Dice Bowl Football is a two-player game where opponents coach teams in a battle of wits.

The game comes with twelve special dice representing offensive plays, defensive formations, and special teams. Each coach calls a play, and dice are rolled depending on the calls. The offense chooses a play based on risk vs. reward. If the defense anticipates the play correctly, they roll more dice and have a better chance of stopping the offense.

There are no complicated charts to search through after each play is called. The outcome of the play is read directly from the dice. Quickly the coaches move on to the next play, and the action is never bogged down.

Despite this simplicity of play, the game contains all the moves and strategy of a real football game. Everything that can happen in football can happen on your game table, from Onside Kicks to Long Bombs. Aside from offense and defense, there are also dice for special plays, penalties, and kicking.

Includes everything you need to play a game: 12 dice with customizing stickers, card decks representing the playing field, scoreboard, and game clock, 4 scoring rings, 2 field markers, a large cloth bag, and instructions for playing.

The field is built by laying out the provided standard-size cards, which means that all components fit into a large cloth bag. This makes it easy to take Dice Bowl along to tailgates, picnics, and parties. Dice Bowl is a great family game with a nice mix of strategy, gamesmanship, and a little luck!

114386.name: 18PA
114386.description:
18PA is a 18xx game roughly covering the area of Pennsylvania. Designer David G. D. Hecht describes it as gentle, and fairly short game.

18PA includes 16 companies, including local companies, land grant companies, and public companies with different rules for managing them. Rules include merger of small companies to NYC, mining city with mining rights, public companies acquiring local companies, and land grant companies profiting from building of tracks.

(DGDH edit, 22 January 2014)

The game now has seven major companies, of which six start as 5-share companies and the seventh--the NYC--forms as a 10-share company by merger at the start of phase 4. The land grant rules have been almost entirely eliminated, except that four of the six companies available at the start have a doubling token, similar to the ones in Bill Dixon's 1850.

There are also nine smaller companies which are a hybrid between privates and minors. Three of them are the predecessors of the NYC, and the remaining six can merge with any connected company, again after the start of phase 4.

114387.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Europe at the start of the 20th century: Foreign cultures and their artifacts have a strong appeal for archeologists, and its in that role that players try to increase their knowledge in order to equip and conduct expeditions to Egypt, Mesopotamia, Crete and Greece. Glory and esteem are waiting!

Thebes: The Tomb Raiders is a card game version of the Thebes board game from designer Peter Prinz and Queen Games. The game dispenses with the map of Thebes, but retains many of the main aspects of the game. The main turn-order play of the game is based on the time-track; players must spend time to take actions, with varying amounts of time spent dependent on the nature and benefits of the action. The player who is furthest back "in time" is the active player. Players use actions to gain knowledge about five civilizations, and then use this knowledge in different actions to "dig" to pull cards from a civilization's deck that contains treasures and dirt. The more knowledge a player has about a civilization, the more efficient the player is at searching for treasures.

The game plays over a certain span of time, and when all players can no longer take any actions because they are out of time, the game is at an end, and the player with the highest score from their accumulated treasures wins.
114387.name: Thebes: The Tomb Raiders
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 43: Even Dwarf Women Have Beards
Episodio 10 – ¡Juegos, juegos, juegos! y ¡jornadas, jornadas, jornadas!

114388.name: Pennant Race: The heated battles of 12 ball clubs
114388.description:
The tabletop baseball game for Japanese professional baseball. This game customized to fit Japanese style baseball based on APBA Pro Baseball.

The game mainly affected by batting ability, and sometimes affected by pitching and fielding ability.

Players manage one of twelve baseball clubs. If skilled players, one game can be completed within 10 minutes.　Therefore, not only single game or short series of few games, you can play a full regular season of a year.

This game first published in 1984 with 1983 season's data. And, has been published continuously until 1990.

114389.description:
New promo card that can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

Zombie Twins:
Can team up with any one Zombie group. Counts as two zombies.

"Zombie Card Game" is no longer included in the ZA edition.
114389.name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Card Game & Zombie Twins Promo

114390.description:
This new promo can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

Zombie Grizzly:
Attack the most powerful character not protected by a Refuge each turn. All characters killed are placed in the Crisis Event's Kill Pile.
114390.name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Grizzly Promo Card

114391.description:
These new 3 promo cards can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

Occult Artifact:
Place the Necronomicon with the most powerful Human in play. That Human is now +5/+10 and can only be attacked by Humans. The most powerful characters in the Kill Piles is summoned each turn. Place all summoned cards in the Crisis Event's Kill Pile.'

Nuclear Assault:
All cards in play are destroyed. Each player places their destroyed cards in their opponent's Kill Pile (or the player to the left in multiplayer).

Marauders:
Attacks the weakest Human in play each turn. If the weakest Human is in a Refuge, the Refuge and any Weapons are destroyed. Place all taken cards in the Crisis Event's Kill Pile.
114391.name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Crisis Event  Promo Cards

114392.name: Piastowie Narodziny Orła
114392.description:
Try your hand as a Prince of the Slavic tribes. Prudent management of network resources to build economic power. Show your strength and courage and obedience among the warriors gain and advantage on the battlefield. Prove that you deserve to be called the first Polish ruler!

It is a breakthrough ninth and tenth centuries. The three ambitious princes at the head of the three great tribes are preparing to fight for the lands of Wielkopolska and Kujawy. Polanie, led by Siemowit extend their rule, the submission of its subsequent settlement and erected at strategic locations mighty castles. Goplanie tribe inhabiting Kujawy, led by cruel Popiel, are preparing to invade the lands lying to the left Noteć river. Lords of the Glapian tribe in Kaliska region push to the north, trying to grab the fertile lands of central Wielkopolska. The eyes of all the princes look at Gniezno, where is Lech Hill most important center of Slav worship. The prince, who will conquer Gniezno, will gain great authority among the Slav population, which may force the rulers of other tribes to submit to his authority. However, the princes plans can be thwarted. There are rumors that at the mouth of Warta strengthen the invaders from the far north, the Vikings ...

Board game "The Birth Piast Eagle" is designed for 2-4 people. Playing time is approximately 2-4 hours, depending on the number of players. Their task is to get as much the prince's authority as possible. They can expand it by winning the general, a reasonable policy, Stewardship of goods and skillful manipulation of the priestly caste. Players may also lose the authority as a result of shameful defeats or show weakness in intertribal political arena.

"The Birth Piast Eagle" is a history-strategic game. Players moving tokens, indicating different types of early medieval armies. Players giving orders have to decide what action it will take in the next stage of their subjects. Depending on the order of the generated power player, these activities take on momentum or slow down. Events included in the pages of random events can absolutely interfere with the planned course of play, forcing players to complete the reform of the established strategy.

Game Design is the winner of a competition organized by the historiographer Polish History Museum and funded by the Ministry of Culture and National Heritage in the financing of educational and cultural activities by the "education +".

Characteristics of the tribes in the board game "Piast Eagle Rise"

Glapianie:
This is the Slavic tribe has its headquarters on the southern edge of the board of the central stronghold - Kalisz. Their unmistakable tramp over the years built a network of trade and diplomatic relations and strong economic fundamentals. Due to the high economic potential of their treasury fills up quickly. Some minor deficiencies in the disposal of the military are offset by the money, according to the rule: "War is not so much a question of weapons, what the money" - Thucydides.

Glade:
This starts the game Slavic people in the central part of the board - in Giecz. This site brings with it a blessing and a curse. Is extremely advantageous location close to major towns in the game, including Gniezno. While the downside is undisputed that the Glade are surrounded by "benevolent" neighbors from four sides. Polan's strengths is military power, whose core is the cavalry, as well as the ability to quickly build great castles.

Goplana:
This is the Slavic tribes settled in the vicinity of Lake Gopło headquartered in Kruszwica. Begin the game in the eastern part of the board. Their military potential - economic development is balanced, thus, are very formidable opponent. Have the ability to quickly mobilize resources, and a lot of defensive capabilities.

Vikings:
The tribe is led by visitors from far northern lands. They begin the game board in the north west - the Santoku. Have the greatest military potential, the most important role is played by an elite infantry Scandinavian. Neither the army nor the stockade could not stop them in the march of Gniezno. The problem may be difficulties in the supply and finance - "Money is the nerve of war," Cicero.

114393.name: Kordonia
114393.description:
Confrontation between two players in a fantasy world.
Players assume the role of military leaders.
The playing field consists of hexes. Each player has his army, which enters the game for the resources obtained at the beginning and during the game. Resources received from special hexes. Army players can be activated with dices. Victory depends on the scenario. This is usually certain conditions or set points.

114394.name: Anima Tactics: Ignis, Fire Demon
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114394.description:
Capricious, ephemeral, and somewhat mean spirited- Fire Demons summoned to Gaia can be challenging for a Summoner to control. If their mercurial natures can be contained and channeled, their destructive potential is inarguable.

Dark Summon Warrior
Level 20 version
At 3 | Dm 8 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 18 | Re 9 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 40 | Bind: 1 | Stability: 7 | Shock: 0
Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance.
Fire Aura: Any enemy Character that comes into base-to-base contact with Ignis for the first time in a game loses 3 Life Points. Effect 15.
Ash Veil: Any Ranged Attack that targets Ignis or has a Line of Fire that passes within 2 inches of him gets -2 attack.
ooo - Inferno (Magic, Attack)
Inferno ignores the defender's Armor.

Level 30 version
At 3 | Dm 8 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 18 | Re 9 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 40 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 7 | Shock: 0
Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance, Critical Mastery.
Fire Aura: Any enemy Character that comes into base-to-base contact with Ignis for the first time in a game loses 3 Life Points. Effect 15.
Ash Veil: Any Ranged Attack that targets Ignis or has a Line of Fire that passes within 2 inches of him gets -2 attack.
ooo - Inferno (Magic, Attack)
Inferno ignores the defender's Armor.

114395.name: Jedi x Sith
114395.description:
From the Introduction:

The Jedi have been infiltrated by Sith! The Council has charged young Jedi Knight Momoko with rooting out any Sith infiltrators or Dark Side masters hiding within the Jedi ranks.

Jedi x Sith is a play set for G x B (Girl x Boy). You'll need a copy of G x B to play.

Here's how it works: Momoko has three suspects, the brash and rebellious Knight Ichigo, the respected and well liked Knight Risa and the brilliant but mysterious Knight Takamichi. Momoko will go on a mission with each Jedi, studying their techniques and trying to uncover their true allegiance. After the three missions Momoko will report her findings to the Jedi Council, and if there is a Sith infiltrator, confront the traitor!

114396.name: Anima Tactics: Al-Djinn
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114396.description:
Al'Djinn are ancestral spirits whom dared to defy the gods, they have been imprisoned and isolated as punishment for their foolishness. The Condemned, The Manipulators of Fate … many are the names of the Al'Djinn. The greatest summoners can still call them to Gaia. While they are constrained by the many rules imposed by their imprisonment, they can still use their demigod like powers to alter the destiny of the world in many ways.

Dark Summon Mystic
Level 40 version
Att: 3 | Dam: 1 | Def: 9 | Arm: 0 | LP: 13 | Res: 11 | Mov: 6/10 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo Affinity: Dark
Atman: 60 | **Bind: 1 | Stability: 8 | Shock: +3
Innate Abilities: Flight, Intangible
Truncation of Fate: Enemy units of level 40 or below in Al-Djinn's control zone can not use Gnosis points.
o - Absolute Change (Magic, Effect):
The Al-Djinn becomes a copy of any other level 50 or lower unit in play. Taking on all of its statistics and abilities (Attributes, Maximum Action Points, Recovery, Skills,…). However, it retains the LP and AP it had when it changed. At the beginning of the recovery Al-Djinn may either continue to copy the other character or may revert to its statistics and abilites (again maintaining LP and AP totals)
oo - Ash Slave (Magic, Effect):
Put a level 20 agent of any organization into play within the Al-Djinn's control zone. The Agent enters play with 2 action points. When the agent's LP reach 0 or less, the ability stops being maintained, or if Al-Djinn leaves the game then the Ash Slave is also removed from the game. This ability can be used multiple times to get multiple Ash Slaves, but each has its own Upkeep cost.
Upkeep: o

Level 50 version
Att: 3 | Dam: 1 | Def: 10 | Arm: 0 | LP: 16 | Res: 12 | Mov: 6/10 | AP 3/4**
Cost to Summon: oo Affinity: Dark
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 7 | Shock: +3
Innate Abilities: Flight, Intangible
Truncation of Fate: Enemy units of level 50 or below in Al-Djinn's control zone can not use Gnosis points.
o - Absolute Change (Magic, Effect):
The Al-Djinn becomes a copy of any other level 60 or lower unit in play. Taking on all of its statistics and abilities (Attributes, Maximum Action Points, Recovery, Skills,…). However, it retains the LP and AP it had when it changed. At the beginning of the recovery Al-Djinn may either continue to copy the other character or may revert to its statistics and abilites (again maintaining LP and AP totals)
oo - Ash Slave (Magic, Effect):
Put a level 25 agent of any organization into play within the Al-Djinn's control zone. The Agent enters play with 2 action points. When the agent's LP reach 0 or less, the ability stops being maintained, or if Al-Djinn leaves the game then the Ash Slave is also removed from the game. This ability can be used multiple times to get multiple Ash Slaves, but each has its own Upkeep cost.
Upkeep: o

114397.name: Anima Tactics: Ahriman, Lord of Darkness
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114397.description:
The Ahriman are the dark twins of the maidens of light. The most powerful known dark elementals. With their unique powers, they are virtually unstoppable. The lords of Darkness have once again set their sites on Gaia.

Dark Summon Warrior/Mystic
Level 40 version
At 5 | Dm 5 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP: 17 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 60 | Bind: 1 | Stability: 8 | Shock: +1
Innate Abilities: Immunity (Blind).
Soul Disruption: If Ahriman deals 5 or more damage with a hand-to-hand attack, the target suffers Seal Lv.2. Units with Damage Resistance are immune to this skill. Effect 15.
Darkness Claws: Ahriman's attacks ignore the Shield and Protection states on enemy units.
o - Darkness (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Ahriman's Control Zone suffers Blind Lv.1. Effect 15. Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Doom (Magic, Effect)
All enemy Units within Ahriman's Control Zone when this skill is used get -1 Attack and Defense until the end of the turn. Effect 16.
ooo - Catastrophic Darkness (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 Inch). +2 Damage. If this attack hits the target, all Units within 3 Inches to the target also suffer the attack.
ooo - Dark Ender (Ki, Attack)
+1 Attack. Dark Ender can target an enemy Unit up to a distance of 2 Inches away, even if Ahriman is not in base contact with it.

Level 50 version
At 6 | Dm 5 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP: 17 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 8 | Shock: +1
Innate Abilities: Intangibility, Immunity (Blind).
Soul Disruption: If Ahriman deals 5 or more damage with a hand-to-hand attack, the target suffers Seal Lv.2. Units with Damage Resistance are immune to this skill. Effect 16.
Darkness Claws: Ahriman's attacks ignore the Shield and Protection states on enemy units.
o - Darkness (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Ahriman's Control Zone suffers Blind Lv.1. Effect 15. Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Doom (Magic, Effect)
All enemy Units within Ahriman's Control Zone when this skill is used get -1 Attack and Defense until the end of the turn. Effect 16.
ooo - Catastrophic Darkness (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 Inch). +2 Damage. If this attack hits the target, all Units within 3 Inches to the target also suffer the attack.
ooo - Dark Ender (Ki, Attack)
+1 Attack. Dark Ender can target an enemy Unit up to a distance of 2 Inches away, even if Ahriman is not in base contact with it.

114398.name: Anima Tactics: Arkham
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114398.description:
Arkham is an ex Order of the Magus member who became unhealthily fascinated with immortality and undeath. He is now one of the main field researchers participating in Black Sun's necromantic weapons testing. Surrounded by a legion of spectral ravens, utilizing traditional black magic, and commanding many undead minions this dark wizard will stop at nothing to achieve his goal of becoming the ultimate form of undead.

Dark Black Sun Mystic - Lv. 35
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP 11 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 2/4
Guidance Points: 2
ooo - Soul Scavenger (Magic, Effect)
Choose an Enemy Unit within Arkham's Control Zone. Until the end of the Turn, all attacks made against that Unit will automatically cause a Critical Hit, regardless of the outcome of the Attack roll. Effect 15.
oo - Legion of Crows (Magic, Attack)
+4 Attack. This Attack affects every Unit within 4 inches of Arkham, except Summons and Undead.
oo - Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 Inches. +1 Attack / +2 Damage.
oo - Raven Flight (Magic, Run)
Move Arkham up to 16 inches. While Making this movement Arkham has Flight.

114399.name: Anima Tactics: Clover
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114399.description:
Warrior, officer… and more than human, Clover is one of the five original Black Sun seekers who found the Book of the Dead more than a decade ago. Transformed by his contact with the forces of unstoppable power contained within that fell grimoire, he is neither dead nor alive. As the member of the Delacroix family most suited to military command, Clover is now the leader of Black Sun’s security forces, the largest private army on all of Gaia.

Neutral Black Sun Leader Warrior - Lv. 70
At 6 | Dm 6 | Df 10 | Ar 1 | LP 18 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5
Superior Undead: Clover may be considered Undead at his controller’s discretion. So for effects that benefit him he may be considered Undead, whereas for effects that hinder him he will not be considered Undead. Clover doesn’t suffer from the Uncontrollable rule or have an Influence value.
Inhuman Force: If desired, any of Clover’s Attacks can cause Throw.
Focus: Once per Turn, Clover may give +2 to one of his Attack or Dodge rolls.
ooooo - Prometheum (Ki, Charge)
After this Charge is resolved, Clover may make up to 2 additional Charges, moving up to 4 inches for each, automatically Escaping from combat where necessary.
o - Everlasting (Magic, Reactive, Effect)
Clover loses all of the Action Points he has left, recovers all his Life
Points, and gains Shield Lv. 1. Limit: Once per game.
oo - Neokinesis (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
Clover gets Haste Lv. 2. Limit: Once per game.

114400.description:
Spice is a short game for two players. Spice is a very simple adaptation of Ketchup for play with the Shibumi game system.

In Spice, the goal is to have the largest group of stones when the game is complete. A group is defined as stones that are "touching", either orthogonally or one on top of the other. The game is over when all the spaces on the gameboard have been filled.

Players play with either RED (ketchup) or BLACK (pepper) stones, and the game begins with a small WHITE 5-stone 2x2 pyramid in the center of the gameboard. The white stones cannot be removed and are neutral, they do not count toward either player's groups of stones.

On the first turn of the game, Ketchup must place 1 RED stone in any empty space. On subsequent turns, players put 1 or 2 stones of their color in any empty space on the board.

If the largest group of stones on the board after your turn is larger than the largest group of stones (of either color) before your turn, then your opponent may remove one of your "free" stones on their next turn (and only on their next turn).

The game ends immediately when the board is full, but the top stone is removed before scoring.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
114400.name: Spice

114401.name: Anima Tactics: Deimon
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114401.description:
Deimon is the head butler and guardian of the Steiner family, a man of inflexible will and indomitable skill.

Light Black Sun Warrior - Lv. 45
At 4 | Dm 6 | Df 8 | Ar 2 | LP 20 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/4
Psychocrystal: At the end of the Upkeep Phase you may have Deimon suffer up to three separate negative states at Lv. 1. Deimon gets +1 Damage for each negative state counter on him no matter how they got there.
Butler: At the beginning of the game you must chose another friendly unit to be Deimon's master. Summons and Undead can't be chosen as Deimon's master. Deimon can Intercept a Ranged Attack or Charge that targets his master if he is within 4 inches of the Line of Attack. If Deimon's master is destroyed, he gets Berserker Lv. 3.
Attendance: During the Recovery Phase, if Deimon is within 4 inches of his master, he may recover 1 less Action Point to have his master recover 1 more.
ooo - Psychochange (Ki, Attack)
+4 Attack. If this Attack causes damage, transfer all of the negative state counters on Deimon to the defender. Effect 18.
ooo - Psychocrusher (Ki, Attack)
+1 Attack. This Attack causes Throw and affect all enemy units within 2 inches of Deimon.

114402.name: Anima Tactics: Kingsley Warlock
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
114402.description:
Kingsley Warlock is one of the CEOs of Black Sun, as well as one of the most trusted agents of the Delacroix family. Master of both the sword and the darkest arts, he uses his control over the undead to greatly increase Black Sun’s, as well as his own, influence.

Dark Black Sun Warrior Mystic Controller - Lv. 50
At 5 | Dm 6 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP 16 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Guidance Points: 2
Blood Magic: Whenever Kingsley uses one of his Magic Abilities he loses 1 Life Point.
ooo - Curse of Damballa (Magic, Attack)
If this attack causes damage, the target suffers Blind, Seal, Slow, and Doom all at Lv. 2. Effect:16.
ooo - Tonnere Diable (Magic Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. -1 Damage. If this Attack causes damage the target suffers Poison Lv. 2. Effect:16.
o - Attzan (Magic Effect)
Until the end of the turn, enemy units that are more than 8 inches away from Kingsley can’t draw Line of Sight to him.
o - Ogoun (Magic Effect)
Until the end of the turn, whenever an enemy unit causes Kingsley damage, they lose an amount of Life Points equal to the damage caused to Kingsley. If Kingsley dies as a result of the damage dealt to him, then this ability will not cause the unit that dealt the damage to lose Life Points. Effect 14.

114403.name: The Magical Land of Yeld (Playtest Edition 2.0)
114403.description:
From the Introduction to the Play Test Document:

Welcome! The book you hold in your hands is a door, leading to the strange and dangerous world of Yeld.
